story:
We want you to help us improve safety at sea and save lives, save ships, save the environment.

Why?

More than 90 per cent of the world's trade is carried aboard ships. The computer equipment on which you are reading this was almost certainly transported by ships manned by some of the world's 500,000 seafarers. Your refrigerator and, probably, much of the food you store in it, reached you aboard ship. Their work is all around you.

What happens to them affects you, whether you are in the maritime industry or not.

Chances are that you only hear about those ships when an accident happens, lives are lost, vessels founder, the environment damaged by oil leaks. Maritime Accident Casebook sets out to reduce that toll by reaching out to seafarers in an entertaining language they can understand to help them work safer and navigate more safely, at at no cost to the seafarer.

By crowdfunding Maritime Accident Casebook we also give seafarers a direct involvement in their safety.

Who?

Maritime Accident Casebook was launched in summer 2006. It reaches out to seafarers through podcasts, case studies and safety information presented in a lively, easy-to-understand way. It posts new material daily.

It is known for its forthright opinions, its pro-seafarer stance, and its sometimes bumptious nature.

It has become respected by seafarers and maritime safety personnel and is regarded as a credible source of safety-related information.

It is independent, does not accept advertising and does not publish press releases or product/service puff pieces. It does not charge a subscription.

In addition to its own site, Maritime Accident Casebook also leverages maritime social media to get its messages out, reaching 7,000 seafarers and maritime professionals each moth, and manages the 7,000-strong member Linkedin group for maritime safety and investigation. 

Until now Maritime Accident Casebook has been a voluntary labour of love, a personal unpaid mission. Now we want to do more - developing new ways of reaching seafarers through different media and doing it better and more professionally.

That is why we are reaching out to you to help us save lives, save ships and save the environment.

What Next?

We're seeking $35k of sponsorship and support. That will:

Allow for building a small audio studio for more professional podcasts.

Allow selected podcast to be presented as animated videos.

Develop the SafeSpace project on enclosed/confined space safety.

Allow for one full time administrator/writer/editor

Allow additional freelance writers to be recruited.

Create three books of case studies, with quizzes, covering confined space entry, lifeboats and mooring operations. To be available free of charge in ebook format and at low cost in hard copy.

Your onsite perks, sponsor's messages, appear when you have logged your contribution, good for one year from 1 October 2014.

Plan B

If we don't reach our target then we will prioritise what we can do with what we have to get the safety message out. We will honour the perks, of course.  New writers and analysts who work the way we do are a priority. We may need to reduce the number of new podcasts and deelay plans for animated podcasts. All sponsors will be advised of how we intend to deal with the shortfall if it occurs.

All accounts will be available to sponsors to ensure that they can see that we're doing our due diligence in a transparent way.

The Team

Bob Couttie

With some 20 years involvement in maritime safety training and accident analysis Bob Couttie is well known in the industry. He established Maritime Accident Casebook and has guided its development since 2006.

He brings a broad range of communications skills to the project.

Thomas Timlen, Asia Liaison Officer at the influential maritime industry organisation BIMCO says:

Bob's initiative to tackle the shipping industry's challenging issues is noteworthy and noble. He addresses many pressing issues, many controversial, in an informed and inspiring manner, adding a dynamic dimension to debates that many would rather see hushed-up. This is an admirable effort, I hope more within and outside the industry would listen!

Steven Haw, Senior editor (English), International Maritime Organization, says:

"I've just put the new consolidated edition of SOLAS to bed. Your website is a valuable resource that puts its regulations right into the real world. Brilliant work!"

Backing up Bob Couttie's efforts is a team of industry professionals, from well-experienced master mariners to senior executives of some of the largest shipping firms in the world.

What you can do if you can't sponsor
If you can't sponsor, for whatever reason, then the most important thing  you can do is get the Maritime Accident Casebook site out there to seafarers. Do that and you'll be helping to save lives, save ships and save the sea.

story:
Sage Mountain Center and Healing Waters :

Sage Mountain Center, an off-grid demonstration and education center for sustainable living, offers tours, workshops and seminars to the public. It was founded by Linda Welsh and Christopher Borton in 1991.

We've launched our Healing Waters campaign because we need help completing an important earthworks project started in 2013 with the support of Alanna Zrimsek, under the guidance of Zachary Weiss and Sepp Holzer.

During the development of Sage Mountain Center, we've witnessed continuous drought, a radical increase in fires, and have watched the predominantly pine mono-culture in the surrounding national forest slowly wither and die.

Our Crater Garden will help us reach the next level in our quest for sustainable living by demonstrating a creative approach to growing food in a Holzer-style microclimate, amidst wild fluctuations in temperature, low humidity, and only 12 inches of precipitation per year.  The moist and verdant Crater with pond will saturate the earth body, mitigating fire danger, and fostering plant diversity.  The earthworks will create forms and features that will become productive thriving micro-climates.

In contributing to our campaign, you will help us demonstrate one sustainable and innovative answer to the challenges people face in high, dry and cold environments.  This unique Crater Garden will strengthen our education center, and enable us to provide a living example of the healing power of water that is directed and held on the land creating an oasis in the most arid Mountains in Montana.

 

Funding

We are in need of $33,000 to complete the Crater Garden.       

It will cover the costs of:

- Heavy equipment rental, operation, and fuel for the creation of the Crater Garden.

- Clay, Manure, and Straw: the raw material inputs for the garden. 

- Plants and seeds, to reestablish healthy plant families for a thriving ecosystem.

We will put all contributions that we receive toward the completion of our Healing Waters Project  - even if our goal is not met.

 

The Ripple Effect of a Single Stone:

Our Crater Garden will provide a living example of how to work with nature to create thriving and productive ecosystems in the most severe of climates.  In the Crater Garden, rock, soil, and water retain heat from the sun, providing an enhanced and balanced micro-climate.  The sunken state of the garden provides protection from wind and damaging weather.  During winter the garden will catch additional snow brought by the wind, providing valuable insulation until winter is over.  Rocks unearthed during excavation are set into the slopes of the terraces like passive solar-thermal radiators;  trapping the sun's warmth while also condensing additional moisture from the air.  The area surrounding the boulders will become a warm, moist micro-climate.   All of these features and much more will combine to create a greatly enhanced micro-climate, which will extend and improve our growing season.

This is Terra-forming on a large scale, using the resources nature provides as responsibly as possible.  It is returning to our roots as cultivators of the planet; a marriage of the resources of today with the wisdom of the past, and the intention of providing an example for the future.

Successful completion of this project will enable us to share the details of the process, and empower as many communities as we can to heal our earth with water, one project at a time.

The Krameterhof in Austria has provided a living demonstration of how to work with time and nature to create a thriving and healthy environment to live and work in.  Thousands of people have received inspiration for their own projects by visiting this tremendous place.  Our intention is to establish a similar example in North America.  Crater Gardens have been successfully implemented in Siberia and Kazakhstan; two  analogous climates to the top of the continental divide in the Rocky Mountains where Sage Mountain Center located.  

 

Other Ways to Contribute:

Help us Connect 

If you'd like to help us, but can't make a financial contribution, help us get the word out! Utilize the Indie Go-Go share tools and share the Healing Waters project on Facebook, Twitter, Google, and You Tube.

Give A Helping Hand  

If you'd like to help us, but can't make a financial contribution, help us get the word out! Utilize the Indie Go-Go share tools and share the Healing Waters project on Facebook, Twitter, Google, and You Tube.

Volunteers will be needed and extremely helpful in the coming months and years! The plants and trees will need to be tenderly cared for while they are getting established, and consistently maintained as the years go by.  Check our website for volunteer opportunities.  We'd love to have you come lend a hand, and learn about the healing power of water.  

We have many wonderful gifts to offer in gratitude. Their donation levels and descriptions can be seen on the right side of the screen.

story:
Shortcut url: http://igg.me/at/tax-refunds-to-free-energy

and http://FundSterling.com

 

Short Summary

As you know, our motto is "Finding and Facilitating the Best Exotic Free Energy Technologies" -- a quest we've been on for nearly 11 years now. And as you will see in our listing at http://Top5Energy.com, there are indeed many very promising technologies getting very close to market, with newcomers to the quest arriving quite regularly.

No one else out there is providing the kind of coverage that we have been providing for over a decade, though there are a few specialized news services emerging in specific areas, especially LENR. We cover the spectrum of exotic (and sometimes conventional) free energy breakthroughs.

We would like to get to a point where we don't need to do any fundraisers for PES. We present here a couple of things we'll be pursuing to reach that objective in the fairly short term, even before some of these technologies emerge into the marketplace where we can benefit from the role we've playing in facilitating their success.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here are some of the wants and needs we have -- how we will be using your funds. We hope to far surpass the fundraising goal, both to increase our ability to develop a self-sustaining revenue stream, and at least to lengthen the time until we need to do another fundraiser.

ONGOING

  • Continuing our daily free energy news coverage, tackling those subjects that seem to us to be the most promising, keeping you abreast of these developments.
  • Networking with inventors, investors, businessmen, potential licensees, other media, and engineers to help facilitate the forward movement of the most promising technologies so they can be made available to you (and the rest of humanity) more rapidly.
NEW PROJECTS
  • We have secured the previously-unclaimed domain name http://FreeEnergyMall.com, and we would like to find someone who can spearhead and manage a website that measures up to this name. This could be a great revenue source for our network as well as a great service to you.
  • We would like to launch a FE Translation Network, headed by a linguist who can oversee the various translators. What they will do is translate our content into their target language, and share in the advertising revenue from that content. It's a win-win-win. The new audience benefits from having access to the content, the translator wins by receiving revenue for their efforts, we win by receiving a share of that revenue to help finance our operations. This can also open up new sources of information for our news and network. Already, more than half of our traffic comes from outside the U.S. due to our recognition that this is a global effort.

VETTING TRIP

  • In the next few weeks, I would like to travel to Florida ($650 budgeted) to see Milan Condric's force multiplier system that has allegedly been third party tested to produce 650+ HP. It uses a combination of pneumatics, wind, mechanical, and another type of energy source to create a base-load capable system that would be very cheap once commercialized. Under NDA, I've seen three videos of it in operation. I would like to be able to see the third-party report, and see the system in operation for myself, so I can have more confidence when approaching potential investors about looking into the technology. If it checks out, it is a potential candidate for our Top 5 listing. I plan on also publishing a report on my trip and what I've seen, without disclosing the details of the mechanism, for your benefit.

PAY BACK LOAN

  • In December, we received a loan for $2000. He was hoping to let it slide for longer, but due to unfolding circumstances, he needs to get it back asap. We will be paying him from our tax return. Also, I still owe another person who loaned us $3000 last October. We don't have enough in our tax return to cover both of these.

The Impact

The arrival of even one of these exotic free energy technologies into the marketplace will radically transform the world. Several of them are getting very close. Our coverage and networking has been playing a pivotal role in helping to move these things closer to fruition.

  • Bring hope to people that solutions are on their way and in process of emerging.
  • It's "power to the people," empowering people by their not having to worry about electricity and fuel for their homes, businesses, and transportation. This will free them up to pursue what they are really good at, as opposed to having to work for others doing things that are not in alignment with their true talents and destiny.
  • It disempowers the powers that be, rendering them obsolete.
  • Clean up the planet.
  • (This list could be very long, but you get the idea.)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • You can help get the word out about this campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

See also

  • http://PESWiki.com - our news and directory site
  • http://PESN.com - our exclusive stories
  • http://peswiki.com/index.php/Directory:PES_Network,_Inc. - about us
  • http://peswiki.com/index.php/Directory:Fundraisers

story:
Please help us save the turtles. The annual return of the turtles starts in August. We need to raise money to educate the community and keep the beach area clean. This is when the area becomes active as people are coming to take the eggs for food.

Volunteers pay for their own travel and meals. Your funds will help provide a place for them to stay. So far, volunteers of Restoring Rosario have been paying for everything themselves. Our volunteers can stay longer and help educate the public on environmental and eco issues.

We are a non-profit involved in the education of the Guatemala community of El Rosario. Our small group of volunteers help wherever is needed. We  teach the public about recycling and environmental awareness. To date, Restoring Rosario has taken loads of plastic waste to the city dumps, provided waste containers, built an environmental friendly incinerator, and work with the ARCAS volunteers watching over the turtle hatchery.

story:
Get-A-Pet is here to save the lives of millions of animals through new and exciting programs and events, which will be designed to benefit not only homeless pets, but the animal welfare community as a whole. We have big ideas and big plans, but we can't implement them without YOUR help!

Get-A-Pet has a 20-year history in the animal welfare community that began with Get-A-Pet Magazine in 1995 for four (4) years.  Through Get-A-Pet Magazine and a a myriad of Get-A-Pet Events, the lives of over 50,000 animals were saved!

Get-A-Pet is paving the way with new concepts to launch a platform for the next generation of pet adoption! How? Keep reading!

Perhaps our greatest strength is our ability to rally resources to help the rescue community. Our #DrivePetsHome program is an example of how we work with like-minded organizations and individuals to provide much-needed support and resources to animal welfare groups across the country (all of which have been generously donated)!

Beginning on October 1st, 2014, we began a scavenger hunt where we hid  a total of 9 keys to 2014 GMC and Chevy vans filled with natural pet food from Halo, Purely for Pets and Freekibble.com, in each of the following areas - New York, Chicago and Southern California. We're posting Tweets and Facebook posts giving clues to the location of the keys. 

(Visit our social media pages to see updates on new clues and the latest winners!!)

All elements of this program were donated to the rescues! We didn't pay for the vans, the vans in New York and Chicago were donated by dealerships (through significant discounts) and the incredibly kind generosity of a private individual, Dorothy Wasilewski. The van to be given away in Southern California came to us through the generosity of Tustin Buick/GMC, who donated the van outright. The pet food packed into the vans was donated by Halo, Purely for Pets and Freekibble.com.

Get-A-Pet is also slated to hold a 'World’s Largest Pet Adoption Fair’ in January 2015, where we will be attempting to set a record in the Guinness Book of World Records for the most animals adopted in a single event.


Throughout 2015, Get-A-Pet will host four (4) nation-wide events in major metropolitan areas with an estimated total of 20,000 attendees per event. Get-A-Pet’s goal, once again, is to break adoption records and find homes for tens of thousands of adoptable animals in the United States. Our previous events are proof that we can make this happen...

  • Currently, we hold the record for the two largest pet adoption events in history.

  • The safety and security of the animals was paramount, so all attending rescues and shelters used their normal screening and application procedures for animal adoptions.

  • Three of the largest shelters in the area had every animal they brought adopted, leaving those three shelters completely empty for the first time in history.

In preparation and concurrently with these events, we will launch an “Animal Welfare Education and Awareness” campaign through social media to help educate the public about animal welfare issues, including spay and neuter, no-kill, responsible pet care and the importance of adoption and rescue.

Get-A-Pet.com will be a cutting-edge, unique and innovative pet adoption website.

Get-A-Pet.com will feature photos, videos and descriptions of over 500,000 animals up for adoption at over 15,000 animal shelters, humane societies and rescue organizations all across the United States.

Get-A-Pet.com will feature tools and segments that have never been seen before in the animal welfare community.

As a keystone to the Get-A-Pet philosophy, each and every Get-A-Pet program is designed to funnel funding and resources back into the rescue community.

We have set a goal of raising $100,000 for the animal welfare groups in attendance at each of our “World’s Largest Pet Adoption Fair” events. In addition, a portion of all advertising revenues from our website will go to the rescue community!

We will have an e-Commerce portion of the website, which will offer pet products for sale from major retailers, with a portion of all these sales donated to the animal welfare community.

    The Get-A-Pet management team has decades of experience in animal welfare, publishing, technology, events and promotion, and business management.  We have also contracted with experts in website development, public relations and social media, ensuring that we have the best of the best.

    The West brothers, Michael and Mitch, founded Get-A-Pet because of their long and deep love for animals. They set a goal in the early 90s to save the lives of over a million animals, and it is that goal and their passion that will make Get-A-Pet second to none.


    We have budgeted out the cash requirements that are necessary for the launch of our platform. We have determined that $1,000,000 will allow us to launch the World's Largest Pet Adoption Fair Events and our Website while running corresponding major social marketing campaigns that will spread awareness. These projects will save millions of animals, and provide solutions for animal rescue groups never seen before! Our goal is to literally change the trajectory and future of homeless animals and to find every animal a forever home. It sounds crazy, but we think it takes big ideas to change history. 

    Here's the breakdown: 

    We will be holding four (4) nation-wide events in major metropolitan areas in 2015.  We are estimating that there will be at least a total of 20,000 attendees per event.  We will adopt out thousands of animals at each event. Cost will include vendors, rental, staff, equipment, educational speakers, marketing and advertising. This will help increase awareness, and provide us the ability to reach a much larger audience, taking pressure off of local and small animal rescues. 

    We will be attempting to set a Guinness Book of World Records at our first event in January for the most animals adopted in a single event. 

    We will also be running major social marketing campaigns to spread awareness and education about the animal welfare community including spay and neuter, no kill, responsible pet care and importance of adoption and rescue.

    We will also be developing a cutting-edge, unique and innovative website that features photos, descriptions and videos of hundreds of thousands of animals available for adoption from thousands of shelters, humane societies and rescues throughout the nation. We hope to change the future of the way pets are adopted.

    We've put together some pretty exciting perks packages featuring some awesome products. We've included a photo of the physical products so that you can see what they look like:

    • Sticker pack set of 3


    • #drivepetshome T-shirt


    • HUMANe T-shirt


    • KEEP CALM and CARRY TREATS Tote Bag
    The perfect bag to take with you to the park or dog beach! This tote bag will hold everything you need such as doggie bags, toys, and treats, of course! 


    • Whistle
    The Whistle Activity Monitor is a health tracker for your dog. It attaches to any collar and measures your dog’s activities, giving you a new perspective on day-to-day behavior and long-term trends.



    Do you want to be part of saving millions of animals but just don't have the funds to contribute at this time?  YOU CAN STILL HELP!  

    • Help us create a BUZZ about our campaign and heighten awareness!
    • Simply use the Indiegogo Share tools to share our message with your friends.
    FOR THE MEDIA: If you would like to write about Get-A-Pet, you can access our media kit here: http://getapet.com/media.html
story_txt:
Get-A-Pet is here to save the lives of millions of animals through new and exciting programs and events, which will be designed to benefit not only homeless pets, but the animal welfare community as a whole. We have big ideas and big plans, but we can't implement them without YOUR help!



Get-A-Pet has a 20-year history in the animal welfare community that began with Get-A-Pet Magazine in 1995 for four (4) years.  Through Get-A-Pet Magazine and a a myriad of Get-A-Pet Events, the lives of over 50,000 animals were saved!Get-A-Pet is paving the way with new concepts to launch a platform for the next generation of pet adoption! How? Keep reading!




Perhaps our greatest strength is our ability to rally resources to help the rescue community. Our #DrivePetsHome program is an example of how we work with like-minded organizations and individuals to provide much-needed support and resources to animal welfare groups across the country (all of which have been generously donated)!


Beginning on October 1st, 2014, we began a scavenger hunt where we hid  a total of 9 keys to 2014 GMC and Chevy vans filled with natural pet food from Halo, Purely for Pets and Freekibble.com, in each of the following areas - New York, Chicago and Southern California. We're posting Tweets and Facebook posts giving clues to the location of the keys. 
(Visit our social media pages to see updates on new clues and the latest winners!!)


All elements of this program were donated to the rescues! We didn't pay for the vans, the vans in New York and Chicago were donated by dealerships (through significant discounts) and the incredibly kind generosity of a private individual, Dorothy Wasilewski. The van to be given away in Southern California came to us through the generosity of Tustin Buick/GMC, who donated the van outright. The pet food packed into the vans was donated by Halo, Purely for Pets and Freekibble.com.

Get-A-Pet is also slated to hold a 'World’s Largest Pet Adoption Fair’ in January 2015, where we will be attempting to set a record in the Guinness Book of World Records for the most animals adopted in a single event.





Throughout 2015, Get-A-Pet will host four (4) nation-wide events in major metropolitan areas with an estimated total of 20,000 attendees per event. Get-A-Pet’s goal, once again, is to break adoption records and find homes for tens of thousands of adoptable animals in the United States. Our previous events are proof that we can make this happen...

Currently, we hold the record for the two largest pet adoption events in history.
The safety and security of the animals was paramount, so all attending rescues and shelters used their normal screening and application procedures for animal adoptions.
Three of the largest shelters in the area had every animal they brought adopted, leaving those three shelters completely empty for the first time in history.
In preparation and concurrently with these events, we will launch an “Animal Welfare Education and Awareness” campaign through social media to help educate the public about animal welfare issues, including spay and neuter, no-kill, responsible pet care and the importance of adoption and rescue.

story:
The Bungalo Project,

Restoring lost charm and romance to a 1926 home.

The History

To fully appreciate this project's restoration for the future is to take just a few short moments to learn of its very interesting background.  Follow with me in exploring through a brief paragraph a quick journey of the history associated with this home.

  During the War of 1812 a certain Joshua Martin, a Private in Captain Willoughby Morgan’s Company of the 12th U.S. Regiment of Infantry, lost his life fighting for our young country.  His mother, Temperance Cowan, subsequently laid survivor’s claim to 160 acres given free and clear to each of those fighting in the war.  On September 17, 1818 those 160 acres of land with legal description of “The North East Quarter of Section 33 of Township 9N of Range 8E” in the Tract appropriated for Military Bounties in the Territory of Illinois were passed on to her from the lands of the United States via an instrument called a Land Patent with her being the first owner of this land passed on from the United States Government to a private citizen.  Ownership of the original 160 acres upon which this house sits, but which has long since been subdivided into lots for individual houses, even predates incorporated Peoria, Illinois.  It took seventeen more years before Peoria, Illinois was incorporated as a town in 1835.  A copy of that original Land Patent signed by Josiah Meigs, the second Commissioner of the United States Land Office serving under only the fifth President of the United State of America James Monroe is below.


  And it is now that we fast forward in a journey through time one-hundred and eight years later.  The year is 1926 and the area where once the wild prairie reigned supreme was becoming no more.

The Romance:

It is now 1926.  Satchel Paige makes his pitching debut; The first check was sent across the Atlantic by radio FAX; Thomas Edison stated Americans prefer silent movies over talkies;  Babe Ruth hits 3 Home Runs in the World Series;  Disney Brothers Cartoon Studios becomes Walt Disney Studios and an architectural style of home described as the American Bungalo at 411 E. McClure Avenue in Peoria, Illinois welcomed its first owners Willis K and his wife Cora A. Brown.  Eighty-eight years ago now and with a very excited husband and wife this home started its own set of memories and if it could only talk would surely tell us of the happiness and the many children playing in its rooms spanning these many years as it now quickly approaches one entire century of families having once called it "home."  And from a distance even now seen through the eye of a Robert Frost "Stopping By Woods on a Snowy Evening" one can peer into the past and see it as it seemingly and proudly once was.  Yes, as it seemingly once was but only though if viewed from a distance.

But as is the legacy of any home Willis and Cora, due their advancing ages, moved on and in the many years to follow time took its relentless toll on the home.

The toll of time:

But in the real world homes can't talk.  Time tolled relentlessly both internally and externally.  Today it stands and, through a small sampling of images in the picture gallery ( click on the "Gallery 17" tab at the top of this page ), with a much closer look now one can start to see it has indeed weathered many sad events in its life.  Still structurally sound but needing much tender loving care for it to see another eighty-eight years here is an opportunity to join with others through your contribution to breathe new life into her.

   A little of myself:

   Hello.  My name is Tassilo Homolatsch and I have volunteered as the Wednesday chef at "The Daily Bread Soup Kitchen"  (Google YouTube:  The Daily Bread Soup Kitchen.  I am the one in the Chef's uniform) for the past seven years in Champaign, Illinois.  It has been a humbling experience giving back to the community to do my part to help the poor, the unemployed, the underemployed and homeless as have my incredible peers in this phenomenal and totally volunteer organization.

   In my personal career I have been Chief of Pulmonary Function and Therapy to the third largest clinic in Illinois and Director of Pulmonary Function to the thirteenth largest clinic in the United States  Also, I have served on the Champaign County Board of Health.        

   And a little more of the project:

The immediate previous owners of this bungalo had a severely handicapped child who passed away and they later divorced.  After that, neighbors have informed me this home, a representative of a gentler time long gone by, sat vacant incredibly for over two years.

   Providing for future generations:

If you have ever enjoyed home renovation TV programs such as, "This Old House" you will note the wonderful renovations and the new leases on life that are possible.  I was drawn to this home knowing it needed work to restore it to its former charm.  However, my focus will be to modernize without obviously showing it has been modernized.  It is structurally sound, the sadness comes from years of neglect.  The roof, being at the end of its life, leaks in several places.  The plumbing needs be entirely replaced as it is a hodge-podge of various materials slapped together by well-intentioned but obviously unskilled owners.  The cast iron waste water system needs total replacing as it has deteriorated from the inside out for after eighty-eight years it is at its life's end.  The wiring appears an eclectic electric nightmare.  Having been left vacant and uncared for for a period of about two+ years has allowed mold to form throughout the basement which needs be professionally addressed.  The furnace was found to be not functioning and the water heater may have been left full during the winters in an unheated unoccupied house.  And with energy costs continuing, as they will, high tech insulation is high on the list too.  All this may sound both ominous and intimidating but is actually very, very doable for this charming home with a still long, long future life. 

   Going Green will be very important to this project.  Over the years I have purchased homes to fix up and re-sell.  Being now on full social security disability, I look forward to orchestrating this restoration to benefit the future.  Many more families for these next eighty-eight years can still have the opportunity to experience the joy of that very first couple crossing that threshold back in 1926 and proudly say "this my home."

Join with me through your contributions so that future generations will see and so be appreciative of those who showed caring towards this renovation and very worthy restoration project.

Be sure to see all the home's pictures in the image gallery.  Click on the "Gallery 17" tab at the top.

And lastly, please spread the word and share this project through your Facebook, emails, clubs and Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you for your interest and gifts of support.  This is a wonderful project which will not not only benefit the community in the long-term but also the many future generations who can live here and will be able to proudly call this "my home."  It is through your generosity future generations whether saying so outwardly or not - will say "thank you."

story:
Short Summary

I am a resource conservationist in the United States working on a community development program in The Gambia to address deforestation.  This program will provide solar lighting to homes, build highly efficient wood burning cook stoves, and help the people manage their forests sustainably.  The program is designed to teach local people the basic skillset to teach others, create jobs in their community, improve health, and decrease resource consumption in the country.

Deforestation is a major problem in much of the world and rocket stove technology can be as much as 90% efficient.  This program uses local natural building materials to build high efficiency cook stoves. Solar lighting systems have been generously donated to start a rental program where each days electrical fees will go towards funding the next home's lighting.  Teaching forest management ties the new technologies to the communities and allows the new practices to support the community in perpetuity.  Typical family homes in The Gambia house 20 - 30 people, so one stove and one lighting system can make a huge impact.

All I need is approximately $2500 to cover airfare and minor travel expenses from Chicago to Kartong.  My accommodations are graciously being covered by Sandele eco-lodge in the Gambia.  Your small contribution can greatly improve both the environment and human health, as well as being a seed for the program to spread. 

The annual health and environmental impact of open fire cooking:

Health: 4 million deaths each year- Each year toxic smoke from open cooking fires causes four million deaths worldwide and is the leading cause of death in children under five.

Safety: 4 million reported burns annually- Four million women and children suffer painful and debilitating burns from their cooking fires.

Environment: One billion tons of GHGs emitted each year- 500 million cook fires emit nearly one billion tons of greenhouse gases each year and cause massive deforestation.

Poverty: 20 hours a week spent collecting firewood- An average man, woman or child spends 20 hours each week gathering wood. Wood collection takes valuable time that could be spent at work or school.

Approximately 3 billion people worldwide cook over open fires or on inefficient stoves, with profoundly negative effects on the environment, health, and income. These methods speed deforestation and produce harmful emissions that lead to respiratory illness in women and children and to lung cancer in older women. This pollution, according to the WHO, is responsible for 1.6 million deaths annually.

Replacing open fires or inefficient stoves with improved stoves both increases efficiency of fuel use and reduces pollution. It slows deforestation, improves health, saves families money, and empowers women and girls by limiting time spent collecting firewood. And slowing deforestation in turn improves food security by preventing erosion and the loss of ground water and soil fertility.

Open fires are an inefficient use of biomass, such as wood and dung, because biomass burns poorly in open fires and very little of the heat generated actually heats the cooking pot. Improved stoves reduce pollution, by creating cleaner combustion, and increase efficiency, by improving heat transfer. One way an improved stove can improve heat transfer is with a “pot skirt,” a circular piece of metal or ceramic that goes around the cooking pot and forces hot flue gasses to travel up the sides of the pot instead of dispersing into the air.

Deforestation in Africa:

Deforestation is an complex problem. A recent study by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) reported that during the decade from 1980 to 1990, the world's tropical forests were reduced by an average of 15.4 million hectares per year (0.8 percent annual rate of deforestation). The area of land cleared during the decade is equivalent to nearly three times the size of France. The phenomenon of deforestation is occurring globally, in different types of forests, and for different reasons.

At the end of 1990, Africa had an estimated 528 million hectares, or 30 percent of the world's tropical forests. In several Sub-Saharan African countries, the rate of deforestation exceeded the global annual average of 0.8 percent. While deforestation in other parts of the world is mainly caused by commercial logging or cattle ranching the leading causes in Africa are associated with human activity.

Developing countries rely heavily on wood fuel, the major energy source for cooking and heating. In Africa, the statistics are striking: an estimated 90 percent of the entire continent's population uses fuelwood for cooking, and in Sub-Saharan Africa, firewood and brush supply approximately 52 percent of all energy sources.

Land clearing by farmers may contribute as much as fuelwood gathering in the depletion of tree stocks. According to Porter and Brown, conversion of forests for subsistence and commercial agriculture may account for as much as 60 percent of world-wide deforestation.  An estimated 20 to 25 percent of annual deforestation is thought to be due to commercial logging. The remaining 15 to 20 percent is attributed to other activities such as cattle ranching, cash crop plantations, and the construction of dams, roads, and mines. In Africa, governments invest substantially more in cash crops than in food crops as reflected in pricing and marketing policies. However, deforestation is primarily caused by the activities of the general population.

Developing countries rely heavily on wood fuel, the major energy source for cooking and heating.  In Africa, the statistics are striking: an estimated 90 percent of the entire   continent's population uses fuelwood for cooking, and in Sub-Saharan Africa, firewood and brush supply approximately 52 percent of all energy sources.  Land clearing by farmers may contribute as much as fuelwood gathering in the depletion of tree stocks.  According to Porter and Brown, conversion of forests for subsistence   and commercial agriculture may account for as much as 60 percent of world-wide   deforestation.  An estimated 20 to 25 percent of annual deforestation is thought to be due to   commercial logging.  The remaining 15 to 20 percent is attributed to other activities such as cattle ranching, cash crop plantations, and the construction of dams, roads, and mines.  In   Africa, governments invest substantially more in cash crops than in food crops as reflected in pricing and marketing policies.  However, deforestation is primarily caused by the activities   of the general population.

story:
This IndieGoGo campaign is over, but you can still support Ice911!  For more information on Ice911 and our mission to save polar ice, please check out our website at www.ice911.org.  To join our emailing list and receive periodic email about the project, email to updates@ice911.org.  To make an online donation, click here.

You can help make history by helping to support what has been called one of the world's most important Citizen Science projects!

The  write-up for the just-completed IndieGoGo campaign follows:

What if you could help us slow climate change by protecting Arctic ice using an environmentally safe method that helps ice last longer in the spring and summer sun?

Ice911 is a 501(c)3 nonprofit whose research, development and field work have reached an advanced stage in providing solutions to slow one of the accelerating factors in global temperature rise: Arctic ice melt. By increasing the ice’s reflectiveness, we can help restore the Earth’s natural heat shield in the Arctic, rebuild polar habitat and help stabilize global climate.  We have developed this solution in a way that we can remove/reverse anything we do, an extremely important feature we've built into our approach from the beginning.

Our work is meant to reduce the devastating impacts of global climate change to buy the world much-needed time to implement the longer-term solution of wide-spread conservation and sustainable energy measures.

Now it’s time to head to the Arctic - and we can't get there without you.  You can be a true Ice Hero and help us slow climate change's devastating effects as we take the next step to place our first Arctic demonstration area in Barrow, Alaska by donating today.  You'll get some cool perks too!  We only have 3 days left - if you can donate and spread the word today to your networks, we can do this!



A Global Problem:  Reflective ice in the Arctic has melted with shocking speed over the last few decades.

(Satellite images from the work of Rigor and Wallace.)

Though this may at first seem a problem far removed from our daily lives, the consequences of the melt are serious and costly for the entire world, leading to 1/3 of global temperature rise from increased absorption of sunlight during the Arctic summer, as well as contributing to rising sea levels and more devastating storms.


The Arctic ice cap is melting. We have lost over 2 million square kilometers of Arctic sea ice in just 30 years (nsidc.org) in a vicious climate cycle. As the Arctic gets warmer, a great deal of reflective white “multi-year” ice has been lost, changing the landscape from highly reflective white ice to darker "young" ice and open seawater. The multi-year bright ice the Arctic has lost reflected much more sunlight, and when we had more of the bright ice, it was better able to keep the Arctic and the rest of the Earth cooler.



With shrinking quantities of this reflective multi-year ice, more and more ice is lost every year. Breaking this cycle (the Ice-Albedo Feedback Effect) can slow the destructive loss of Arctic ice and reduce the devastating effects of climate change. One solution to reduce the melt is is to change the reflectiveness of some areas of the ice in a local and reversible way to increase the ability to reflect sunlight. Enter Ice911 and its team of dedicated engineers and scientists.



Solution: Ice911 has developed short-term and reversible measures to reduce the far-reaching effects of the loss of reflective Arctic ice.  The idea seems simple, but as with most important engineering projects, it has taken years of development and field testing to work out many important details. We have succeeded in satisfying our important guiding rules: We have developed a way to locally replace the reflectivity of the lost multi-year ice in selected areas, using materials and techniques to First Do No Harm, and with the ability to reverse or remove the materials or effects later.  We can rebuild lost ice reflectivity, and perhaps even reboot the ice by restarting the natural processes to regrow multi-year reflective ice, and it can potentially provide interim habitat for polar bears and other Arctic animals as well.

Methods: Two very workable methods have been developed: Use a safe floatable bright material in a granular form as an ice and snow covering, packaged to protect the environment against any unintended impacts;

or freeze a safe ingredient from the kitchen into the ice itself to make it bright. 

NASA has confirmed that Ice911’s bright ice dramatically slows ice melt. Both methods have important benefits, and we are seeking to get both demonstrated in small-scale field tests in the Arctic as soon as possible in the upcoming Winter/Spring season to inform any decisions for wider deployment to save Arctic ice.

We have developed rigorous, science-based solutions to preserve polar and glacial ice, as well as our own in-house monitoring system to measure the the effectiveness of our materials and the weather conditions at our deployment sites.

 
Solar Weather Ice Monitoring Station (SWIMS), designed by Ice911's Satish Chetty.


Artist's rendition of a SWIMS buoy in action, transmitting real-time weather and ice thickness and brightness data atop a rebuilt, bright ice sheet.

Our immediate goal is to place our first Arctic demonstration area in Barrow, Alaska, starting our deployment in January 2015.  We've done our homework, having gathered on-the-spot information in Alaska on  the logistics, permitting, and budget needed to do do this work, and we're readying ourselves to go.

The ultimate aim is NOT to blanket the Arctic, but to work in the areas of most critical need for preserving ice, coastlines, permafrost and wildlife habitat.

Plan of Record:  One of Ice911’s most important current goals is to assess the effectiveness of this approach by deploying and monitoring a demonstration plot in time to catch the 2015 melting season.  The monitoring instrumentation and initial small ice deployments are to be placed in March, and monitored throughout the melting season.


We've done field testing for years in California, Minnesota and one season in Alberta.  Now we need to do a first on-location demonstrate of our method on a small scale where it is meant to help slow the melt: in the Arctic itself. We are working to raise $97,630 so that we can place our first Arctic demonstration area in Barrow, Alaska this season, 300 miles above the Arctic circle.  Please donate as soon as possible and don't wait until the end of the campaign, as it's crucial that we be able to start putting our demonstration together now.

Here’s where your donations will go:

  • $18,505: Travel, lodging, and transportation in the Arctic (Barrow, AK).

  • $14,225: Local bear guard/ice guide, snow machine and fuel, Siglin sled

  • $12,800: Field site logistics expenses.

  • $48,700: Materials costs, including SWIMS sensor platforms, Ice911 ice preserving materials, instruments to measure ice and materials characteristics, and shipping costs.

  • $3,400: Permitting and fees.

Ice911 has made incredible progress with amazingly generous amounts of volunteered time and donations from friends, family, and close supporters who are passionate about reducing the impacts of climate change, including some essential grants from family-directed foundations to cover our small-scale R&D and field-testing expenses to date. Now we need to bring our work on location to the Arctic, where it can begin its work to help to slow polar ice melt. 

We need your timely and critically important contribution to make our first small Arctic demonstration this winter. You CAN make a difference and take positive action to reduce the effects of climate change--help us make a stand!  Thanks!

What if we don't reach our IndieGogo fundraising goal?:  We will use well all the money that we do raise.  If we meet our fundraising goal, we can experiment at a scale in Alaska that will assuredly yield a definitive demonstration. If we don't meet the goal, but raise enough to do some initial small-scale demonstration, we will do that small-scale demonstration.  If we raise less than that, we will use the funds to continue the field work at our U.S. field sites—lakes and ponds in California, Maine, and Minnesota.

What if we surpass our IndieGogo fundraising goal? In this case, we will further develop our Arctic deployment methods and work on scaling our technology up more quickly to save the ice and reduce climate impacts faster.  With enough funding, we could also start work on developing a polar bear interim habitat.

We need your help to succeed. Please share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media today, and tell your friends that you helped in the fight against climate change! The people who live on the coasts of the world, the people who depend on water for farming and to drink, the polar bears, and our warming Earth, will say thanks.




Leslie Field, PhD, is motivated to do this work on climate stabilization because she is a Mom, worried about her kids' futures.  Dr. Field started Ice911 Research to slow the effects of climate change out of this concern, and she has been working on the problem of melting polar and glacial ice since 2006. Leslie has engineering degrees from MIT and UC Berkeley and has worked extensively in central R&D labs, including Hewlett-Packard Labs.  Leslie has founded two successful technical consulting companies as well as Ice911.  Leslie also serves as a Consulting Professor in Electrical Engineering at Stanford University where she teaches an annual Fall-quarter seminar class in "Engineering and Climate Change."


Satish Chetty, MS, is the CTO of field testing at Ice911 and is the CTO of Beyond 66 Engineering Solutions, a design and consulting company for technology deployed in extreme environmental conditions. He founded the Polar Technology Conference a decade ago to provide a place for scientists and engineers to share information on building sensing and monitoring technology for icy environments.  Satish designs and builds Ice911's monitoring equipment, including our latest SWIMS buoy.


Shalini Venkatesh, PhD, is a Ph.D. Physicist and Optics expert who is also expert in medical physics. Born in India and educated in the United Kingdom, she has worked in the United States since 1988 in corporate R&D and as a consultant.

The Ice911 team and advisers also includes climate scientists, fundraisers, and other scientists and engineering experts. For further information, check out our website.

Ice911's years of work have yielded a way to slow the loss of Arctic ice: safe materials and methods to slow the melt and rebuild the bright reflective ice that the Arctic and the world needs.  You can be an Ice Hero and slow climate change's devastating effects when you help us take the next step to place our first Arctic demonstration in Barrow, Alaska by donating today.

To find out more, please check out our website at www.ice911.org.  Would you also like to join our e-mailing list for periodic Constant Contact updates?  If so, send an email to updates@ice911.org.

Thanks for your interest in sharing in our important work!

story:
Dad and Daughter

We are devout Disciples of Jesus Christ and want to provide clean drinking water to our sister Church in El Salvador.

Dad (Jamal Speakes, Sr.)

  • High School Theatre Teacher 
  • wants to give clean drinking water to my brothers and sisters in El Salvador
  • Great Dad/Daughter bonding time

Daughter (Sharar Speakes)

  • College Student
  • Goal in life is to operate a non-profit that serves third world countries
  • Loves to serve children

What We Need & What You Get

All of the funding is going to travel and living accomodations for the Dad and Daughter to go to El Salvador with their church missions group to drill a well for clean drinking water. This well is the second that the Turning Point Church LA will drill for our sister church and community in El Salvador. None of the money will be used for any luxury expense.

If we don't reach our goal...whatever is raised will still go to our journey!!

The Dad is a professional photographer and plans to take some great pictures of our journey and will be putting together a pictoral journey and the people it will impact.

 

The Impact

  • 783 million people lack access to an improved source of drinking water—that's 1 in 9 of us. In the places we work, it's more like 1 in 2.
  • Many women spend 20 hours per week collecting water, some walking 7 miles a day, often for contaminated water. Too often the walk is not safe for them physically. It is women and the children they raise who suffer most without water, and who benefit most from access to it.
  • Globally, water-related diseases steal 443 million school days a year. Roundworm, whipworm, and hookworm stunt growth, cause debilitating anemia, and follow kids into the classroom, shrinking cognitive potential. Illness causes absenteeism and early drop-out. Simple solutions can keep kids in school.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please check out the link to organization Living Water and see more of what is being done to countries of the world that need clean drinking water. http://www.water.cc

story:
Shortcut URL

http://igg.me/at/Yildiz-mm-fan-tester

See also: http://igg.me/at/Sterling-to-Yildiz-demo

 

CAVEAT

Brainstorm: Publish Yildiz Test Propeller Specs

 

Description

Could it really be true that there is such a thing as an all-magnet motor that can provide rotational torque for useful energy generation, with no apparent input other than what nature provides through principles of magnetism not yet fully understood? Modern science emphatically says "NO", but many inventors over the years have claimed to have defied that prediction, by building working motors.

Now, at the upcoming 41st International Exhibition of Inventions in Geneva from April 10-14, 2013, the world may have a chance to see such a motor.

The Turkish patent office has invited inventor Muammer Yildiz, to whom they awarded such a patent, to display his all-magnet motor at that expo; and he has invited me to participate in that event.

As many of you who follow our Free Energy News know, I've been closely tracking the Yildiz all-magnet motor for the past few months, both in keeping a blog about it at PESWiki updated, as well as in helping to facilitate things through my interactions with the various players, including the inventor; his assistant, Halil Turkmen; the documentary film maker, Rene van der Woude of http://www.mixr.nl; Dr. Jorge Duarte of Eindhoven University, who has been vouching for this technology....

We all, especially the inventor, are anxious to finally see this technology class vindicated once and for all, to never be doubted again.

This would be the beginning of a new scientific and energy revolution -- a paradigm crasher, an eye opener, and the opening of a new path forward in providing clean solutions to the world's energy problems.

With all the interactions I have had on this, many of them confidential, I am very certain about the reality of Mr. Yildiz's motor design being real.

One of the team members I have been in communication with is a Ph.D. student at a European university. He is doing his dissertation on "overunity" systems that go beyond presently-understood laws of physics. The student doesn't yet want his identity or the identity of the university to be publicly known, though I know who they are, and can vouch that they are credible. I saw a letter of reference from the mentoring professor approving the student to participate in the Geneva expo on behalf of the university.

At first, we were hoping to just connect the shaft of the motor to an alternator to power a 1000-W bank of lights. However, Mr. Yildiz decided against doing that due to an experience he's had in the past where such a set-up was done, and the shafts were not properly aligned, and it damaged his motor, requiring him to take it apart, taking several hours to repair it.

Mr. Yildiz doesn't want that to happen while the world is watching at the expo. So he wants to play it safe by just running a 25 cm fan blade, which consumes around 380 Watts at the speed he runs it at. This he knows to be a stable configuration, which will easily hold up.

The question then becomes, "How can we measure that fan in real time?"

The student has proposed a very simple set-up, as shown in the diagram. He would use a Plexiglass tube to direct the incoming air to a fan blade mounted at the back of the tube, which would turn a dynamo and power a small light.

The reason for the ~1 meter separation of the apparatus from the motor is that Yildiz says that ferrous material interferes with the function of the motor, and needs to be at least that far away.

Such a measurement would only be about 20% efficient, so a 380-Watt source would power an 80-Watt bulb. (Good solar panels are only 20% efficient in turning the sun's energy into electricity.)

The purpose for this set-up would not be to give an accurate measurement, but just to provide a reality check, showing by measurement that the output of the motor is indeed in the range that the inventor says it is.

Accurate measurements are planned to take place after the Geneva expo, in lab settings.

What we want to demonstrate at the Geneva expo is that the magnet motor does work, and that it runs for a period of time longer than what could be achieved if there were some kind of batteries or other energy storage mechanism being utilized inside the motor casing.

For the size of the motor, the most likely energy storage would be lithium ion batteries. And if the motor body was full of lithium ion batteries, the amount of power it could produce would be 1700 watt-hours. So in order to fully satisfy the skeptics, the demonstration of Yildiz' motor needs to be for at least long enough to surpass that amount of power.

So if the motor is producing 380 Watts, then it would need to run for 4.5 hours to achieve a 1700 watt-hour output. And the expo is open for 9 hours each day -- twice that time, providing ample evidence that the motor is indeed being powered by something that present science cannot account for.

Of course, Mr. Yildiz could just run the motor and fan without this measurement apparatus, but people would have to thrust his word that the output is equivalent to 380 Watts. But if we were going on trust, then we wouldn't need the demo, right?

So, the purpose of this fundraiser is to reimburse the expense of building this measurement apparatus.

The Ph.D. Student is going to build this, whether or not we help him with the expenses. However, he would greatly appreciate it if we (we the people) could reimburse him, so that he can keep those funds in his kitty for other overunity projects he is investigating and documenting for his Ph.D. That's why I present this as a "flexible funding" campaign, so he keeps whatever is raised.

So help us spread the word. If we raise the full amount budgeted, then Indiegogo only keeps 4%. But if we don't reach the goal, they retain 7%

 

BUDGET:

450 € 30 cm Plexiglas Tube 1,50m
400 € Other CNC-milled plexi-glasparts (equiptment mounting)
600 € Dynamo
  80 € Bulbs, fittings, misc.
250 € Transportation / Parts / Organisation / Workshop
350 € Table
550 € Repeller
110 € Indiegogo Fee

2.790 € = approx. $3600 USD

IF WE SURPASS GOAL...

If we happen to surpass our fundraising goal, some of the things the excess could go to include:

  • Help with other demo expenses in Geneva
  • Help with open license launch expenses
  • Donate to help Yildiz file for PCT patent coverage (not his idea; he does not like receiving funds, but is stubbornly independent, not wanting to give wrong impression about his motives)
  • Maintenance of PES Network
  • Expanding PES Network
  • Ability to assist other inventors

 

SEE ALSO

YILDIZ MAGNET MOTOR FOOTER

  • Directory:Muammer Yildiz Magnet Motor
  • Event:2013:Yildiz_Magnet_Motor_Demos
    • January | February
    • Classifieds:2013:Yildiz_Magnet_Motor_Demo_Needs

MAGNET MOTORS FOOTER

  • Directory:Magnet Motors
  • News:Magnet Motors
  • PowerPedia:Magnetic motor – encyclopedic entry
  • Directory:Linear Magnet Accelerators
  • Directory:Magnetism
  • Directory:Magnets

Now, at the upcoming 41st International Exhibition of Inventions in Geneva from April 10-14, 2013, the world may have a chance to see such a motor. The Turkish patent office has invited inventor Muammer Yildiz, to whom they awarded such a patent, to display his all-magnet motor at that expo; and he has invited me to participate in that event.
As many of you who follow our Free Energy News know, I've been closely tracking the Yildiz all-magnet motor for the past few months, both in keeping a blog about it at PESWiki updated, as well as in helping to facilitate things through my interactions with the various players, including the inventor; his assistant, Halil Turkmen; the documentary film maker, Rene van der Woude of http://www.mixr.nl; Dr. Jorge Duarte of Eindhoven University, who has been vouching for this technology.... We all, especially the inventor, are anxious to finally see this technology class vindicated once and for all, to never be doubted again. This would be the beginning of a new scientific and energy revolution -- a paradigm crasher, an eye opener, and the opening of a new path forward in providing clean solutions to the world's energy problems. With all the interactions I have had on this, many of them confidential, I am very certain about the reality of Mr. Yildiz's motor design being real.One of the team members I have been in communication with is a Ph.D. student at a European university. He is doing his dissertation on "overunity" systems that go beyond presently-understood laws of physics. The student doesn't yet want his identity or the identity of the university to be publicly known, though I know who they are, and can vouch that they are credible. I saw a letter of reference from the mentoring professor approving the student to participate in the Geneva expo on behalf of the university.
At first, we were hoping to just connect the shaft of the motor to an alternator to power a 1000-W bank of lights. However, Mr. Yildiz decided against doing that due to an experience he's had in the past where such a set-up was done, and the shafts were not properly aligned, and it damaged his motor, requiring him to take it apart, taking several hours to repair it.
Mr. Yildiz doesn't want that to happen while the world is watching at the expo. So he wants to play it safe by just running a 25 cm fan blade, which consumes around 380 Watts at the speed he runs it at. This he knows to be a stable configuration, which will easily hold up.
The question then becomes, "How can we measure that fan in real time?"
The student has proposed a very simple set-up, as shown in the diagram. He would use a Plexiglass tube to direct the incoming air to a fan blade mounted at the back of the tube, which would turn a dynamo and power a small light.
The reason for the ~1 meter separation of the apparatus from the motor is that Yildiz says that ferrous material interferes with the function of the motor, and needs to be at least that far away.
Such a measurement would only be about 20% efficient, so a 380-Watt source would power an 80-Watt bulb. (Good solar panels are only 20% efficient in turning the sun's energy into electricity.)
The purpose for this set-up would not be to give an accurate measurement, but just to provide a reality check, showing by measurement that the output of the motor is indeed in the range that the inventor says it is.
Accurate measurements are planned to take place after the Geneva expo, in lab settings.
What we want to demonstrate at the Geneva expo is that the magnet motor does work, and that it runs for a period of time longer than what could be achieved if there were some kind of batteries or other energy storage mechanism being utilized inside the motor casing.
For the size of the motor, the most likely energy storage would be lithium ion batteries. And if the motor body was full of lithium ion batteries, the amount of power it could produce would be 1700 watt-hours. So in order to fully satisfy the skeptics, the demonstration of Yildiz' motor needs to be for at least long enough to surpass that amount of power.
So if the motor is producing 380 Watts, then it would need to run for 4.5 hours to achieve a 1700 watt-hour output. And the expo is open for 9 hours each day -- twice that time, providing ample evidence that the motor is indeed being powered by something that present science cannot account for.
Of course, Mr. Yildiz could just run the motor and fan without this measurement apparatus, but people would have to thrust his word that the output is equivalent to 380 Watts. But if we were going on trust, then we wouldn't need the demo, right?
So, the purpose of this fundraiser is to reimburse the expense of building this measurement apparatus.
The Ph.D. Student is going to build this, whether or not we help him with the expenses. However, he would greatly appreciate it if we (we the people) could reimburse him, so that he can keep those funds in his kitty for other overunity projects he is investigating and documenting for his Ph.D. That's why I present this as a "flexible funding" campaign, so he keeps whatever is raised.
So help us spread the word. If we raise the full amount budgeted, then Indiegogo only keeps 4%. But if we don't reach the goal, they retain 7%
 


BUDGET: 450 € 30 cm Plexiglas Tube 1,50m400 € Other CNC-milled plexi-glasparts (equiptment mounting)600 € Dynamo  80 € Bulbs, fittings, misc.250 € Transportation / Parts / Organisation / Workshop350 € Table550 € Repeller110 € Indiegogo Fee
2.790 € = approx. $3600 USD
IF WE SURPASS GOAL...
If we happen to surpass our fundraising goal, some of the things the excess could go to include:

Help with other demo expenses in Geneva
Help with open license launch expenses
Donate to help Yildiz file for PCT patent coverage (not his idea; he does not like receiving funds, but is stubbornly independent, not wanting to give wrong impression about his motives)
Maintenance of PES Network
Expanding PES Network
Ability to assist other inventors

story:
This project will present up to  6 Large Climate Sticks (7 ft tall) to marchers in the Peoples Climate March in New York City on September 21, 2014.

News Flash - Bill McKibben now supports the Climate Stick - thank you for meeting the goal - no more donations needed here, but the original Indiegogo project,  Climate Stick for Climate Action, in the Community Category, which is funding the production and distribution of 20,000 Climate Stick Pendants at the Peoples Climate March still needs support. Check it out.


Impact

(A personal message from the developer of the Climate Stick for Climate Action project)

Many people are very worried about how fast our climate is changing and how soon these changes will dramatically affect our ability to feed the 7 billion plus people who now inhabit the Earth (not to mention increasingly severe floods, fires, storms and other major climate related events we see weekly now on our TV screens).

But conversation about these issues is so filled with half-truths and competing technologies that as yet we have not been able to create a consensus with the political will to overcome the strength of the fossil fuel industry and its supporters.

I have been giving presentations about climate change for more than six years, and have engineering,  educational and business experience in changing how organizations function. The facts and focus of the climate debate have changed over time but it is still difficult to convey quickly and clearly what is at a stake as we burn more carbon.  Ten weeks ago I discovered a way to make the complete picture clearer with a simple picture – the Climate Stick as I call it. In my last presentations many people “got it” in ways they had not before. 

The Climate Stick for Climate Action project is an attempt to bring the use of the Climate Stick to the national conversation of how we turn the corner and start to directly address the climate crisis. We all know that a mass movement is needed to free up the money that subsidizes coal and oil so that the green energy sources (including energy conservation and efficiency) we need can be brought to implementation a lot sooner that the year 2050 that is given lip service in current debate.

The Climate Stick for Climate Action will bring 20,000 (40,000 if we significantly overachieve our fundraising goal of $22,000) Climate Stick Pendants to the Peoples Climate March on September 21 in New York City to be distributed at no cost by a Street Team of 30-40 people engaging marchers in Manhattan.  Our web-site (cs4us.org) will allow for additional Climate Stick Items to be available to support the building of a mass movement to stop the burning of fossil fuel by 2022.  Yes, a goal all reasonable people think is just impossible. A mass movement could change that. More on this in the Risks & Challenges section.

Our video shows you the Climate Stick and how you can use it in your discussions.

Our Perks will let you get Climate Stick related educational, clothing and jewelry that also convey the story of the Climate Stick.  You are also making a symbol for the mass movement to stop burning carbon as you support the Climate Stick for Climate Action project and use the items you receive as Perks to inform your relatives, co-workers and friends.

Bill McKibben has said “Very few people on earth ever get to say: "I am doing, right now, the most important thing I could possibly be doing." If you'll join this fight that's what you'll get to say.”  This statement directs what I do in my life.  Living it produced the Climate Stick.  If you think the Climate Stick would help you argue for a sane energy policy, and you do, and we stop the burning of carbon, then Bill might just be right.


What you get

First, a tool to help you communicate the issues of the climate debate clearly and powerfully.

Second, a connection to the movement that will ban the burning of fossil fuel in enough time to keep us from increasing temperature past where agriculture can provide enough food for those living on our planet.  Plus an important role in creating the symbol of the movement to stop burning carbon. And the choice of at three different Perks for Climate Stick Tools, Jewelry and Apparel that help you tell the story in your own words.
