story:
Critical Patent Information

The John Device has U.S. and International patents applied for. (USPTO and WIPO)  The U.S. patent has been accepted as a "TrackONE" application, which requires their decision within 12 months instead of the usual 36 months.  The International application was accepted for Early Publication due to the importance of The John Device's technology.  They can be looked up on the respective sites using the title: "The John Device" when searching, or the original, as submitted patent is included in the free book: "The John Device", which can be found at: www.TheJohnDevice.com/TheJohnDeviceBook.pdf

The U.S. patent office has asked me to break the original patent for The John Device down into 11 (eleven) different categories.  Finances are required to meet this requirement and there are still many other patents to file.

This new patent information must be completed by August 25th, which is why I have come to Indiegogo in the first place.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

Now, on with the "campaign"...

Power From Force

It's not really a strange idea when you think about it.

  • Gravity is one force, and there are many others that work with the U.S. and Internationally patent pending John Device's CVRP (Continuously Variable Rotating Plane) Technology.
  • Once you understand, you won't believe the simplicity.
  • This very simplicity will lead to a vast array of products, due to issues such as flexibility and adaptability and manufacturing costs and ease.

However, NO ONE is going to believe in this concept without more information, and that's what the various videos and pictures on the Internet are for.

Ultimately, what you, as a potential contributor needs to believe in is me, David Woodrow John, and that's what my introduction video on Indiegogo is for - to give you a better sense of who I am and where we're all going.

One of the GV ("Gravity" Only Version) Family in CAD


One Man - Two Drs.

One man can do a lot.  So far, one man has imagined the concept (15 years ago), built the machine, created the websites, shot and created the videos, learned CAD, designed multiple new generations, filed U.S. and International patents, and then wrote a book including the patent and copyrighted it.

Two Doctors, a Father with a Doctorate in Math from Purdue, and a Mother with a Doctorate in Education from Stanford, support his efforts.  Retired, fixed-income people, unable to afford extra help with an illness because they have to support one of their Sons who is trying to change the World.

  • Imagine if a single additional person helped.

  • Now imagine two, or even as many as three...  amazing!

Future Work


The Impact

The patent pending John Device can produce electricity from the forces of gravity, bouyancy, magnetism, electro-magnetism, acceleration, and/or deceleration.  It can be:

  • Scaled infinitely large or infinitely small or anywhere in between.
  • Used anywhere.  Under the water.  On top of a mountain.  Underground.
  • Built by you, or purchased from major suppliers and installed.



Risks & Challenges

In years past, the greatest risks perceived were 'Big Oil' and the traditional methods of power generation.  Unfortunately, many industries 'don't like' The John Device, because they fear loss of revenues.
(on a side note, the purveyors of horses, saddles, and associated facilities were undoubtedly not happy with the advent of the automobile...)

  • Alternative: Solar, Wind, and other intermittent energy providers will no longer exist, partially due to their inability to compete on a flat business model, but moreso, because energy companies themselves hate the fluctuating electricity provided by these energy sources. (Home solar has also recently begun to run into problems with Firefighters encountering electrical sources on rooftops while fighting fires.  It's a big deal, actually.)

  • Nuclear and Oil and Gas and all the others will also share the same fate, but for their own reasons of pollution, and also inability to compete.  However, Oil and Gas technologies will continue to be of great interest for their energy density (for the time being) and especially for the upcoming age of 3D printing and AM (Additive Manufacturing) of products at home by consumers instead of purchasing them pre-manufactured at a store.

 



How Everything Works

Along the way, numerous discoveries were made.

The most important is, quite literally, how everything works.

Because of the medical and numerous other implications, I will be releasing the book: "How Everything Works: From Atoms to Universes" free of charge.  For example, in just one medical example, I mention that with the proper assistance, I could easily detect different cancers and exactly where they are in a person within a year.  (I really don't know the qualifications of the 'team', so it's hard to say)  There are so many fundamental changes that will occur in chemistry and also biology that it is impossible to even begin to talk about them all here.   NASA will be thrilled, as will any scientist who is exhausted and tired of dealing with "Gravity."

Simply put, I am offering $10,000 to anyone who can disprove my "theory".

Oh, and by the way, one of the points in this "Theory of Everything" is that Gravity does not exist.  Period.   And so much more...

Think about it, though... By reverse logic, all you have to do is simply prove that Gravity exists and you will win $10,000!!

By actual logic, you will be unable to do that (no one ever has - guess why?), and you won't win $10,000!

For additional information:
www.Torque-Incorporated.com/CHALLENGE.html

Once you understand How Everything Works, everything changes.

Everything.

Wait until you find out how you actually are held to the ground!

Gravity has isolated Mankind.  Unfortunately.

But that is over.  There is a New World coming.

As with this "campaign", in more ways than one.

Your financial support will help me to finish this book sooner rather than later.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Watch, read, and learn.  The John Device isn't a joke.
  • Share if you'd like.  Email people if you'd like.
  • Get ready to smile when you learn You Are Not Alone and that many things you always thought you felt deep inside you were real... are real.

story:
Soclogbo est un petit village au centre du Bénin niché au milieu des collines. Il compte environ 5000 habitants. Soclogbo dispose des infrastructures suivantes : un centre de santé, un centre social, un jardin d’enfants, trois écoles primaires, un collège (qui accueille les élèves de 6è en terminales), un château d’eau et un réseau de distribution d’eau potable…

À Soclogbo, les arbres centenaires comme le baobab, le Néré et l’iroko sont en symbiose avec le paysage accidenté des collines et des vallées …. La vie de ce village s’organise autour de l’agriculture, de la vente des produits issus du travail de la terre ainsi que d’une grande production de bois, – pour la confection des charpentes, la réalisation de meubles et la création d’objets d’art grâce à la sculpture – et de charbon de bois.

Pourtant, une ombre au tableau menace l’écosystème : l’avancée du désert. Additionnée à la surexploitation des ressources, l’absence d’une politique pérenne de reboisement, la situation empire lentement. Des essences séculaires sont attaquées, détruites et brûlées pour satisfaire la demande pressante des grandes villes. Grâce à cette surexploitation de la forêt, certains gagnent l’illusion du pain quotidien et mettent en péril l’avenir de la région. Ce cercle vicieux hypothèque l’avenir des jeunes et des enfants, qui demain vivront dans une région toujours plus sèche et toujours plus aride.

 

Née en avril 2010, l’association Mémoire de Clair de Lune est active dans le domaine de l’environnement, de la culture et du sport. Elle est mue par la volonté de préserver l’authenticité de ce village en menant différentes actions sur le terrain :

  • la sensibilisation des populations locales à l’impérieuse nécessité de reboiser et d’assainir l’environnement ;
  • les campagnes de reboisement, notamment la campagne 2013
  • l’action culturelle notamment autour du livre de jeunesse ;
  • la protection de l’environnement par la création d’un parc, jardin ou square.

Les membres de l’Association Mémoire de Clair de Lune s’investissent personnellement dans ces missions. Ils organisent entre autres activités, le Marathon Maxhili, la semaine du livre de jeunesse, la campagne permanente de reboisement et d’embellissement qui connaît un pic à la saison pluvieuse.

Dans son volet environnement, l’association veut aider à la prise de conscience et montrer par l’exemple qu’il est possible de changer le cours des événements. L’association a fait le pari de reverdir le village et les tentatives de reboisement sont nombreuses. Les activités menées sur le terrain montrent que les habitants accueillent favorablement les idées nouvelles et font preuve de bonne volonté. Les plants sont souvent spontanément accueillis et mis en terre.

Par ailleurs, un terrain de 2 hectares est à la disposition de l’Association afin qu’elle l’exploite au service du village. Plusieurs essences du milieu s’y trouvent naturellement. Le but du présent projet est de délimiter des espaces de verdure, de jeux, de lecture, de travail artisanal, de promenade ; de faire du domaine un parc public. 

Dans cette entreprise, notre premier ennemi est le climat. La sécheresse dure désormais 6 à 8 mois, parfois successifs. Auparavant, la région connaissait deux saisons sèches et deux saisons pluvieuses (à chaque fois une petite et une grande). Quand vient la grande saison sèche, très peu de plants survivent et les hommes, qui n’ont déjà pas assez d’eau à boire, s’étonnent qu’on imagine en donner aux plantes.
Le village possède plusieurs forages, un château d’eau et un réseau d’adduction d’eau plutôt original. Les populations ont donc accès à l’eau potable, soit par l’accès direct au réseau par abonnement, soit par achat d’eau chez des abonnés qui en vendent, soit directement au forage…

De novembre 2012 à mars 2013, il n’a pas eu pluie au village. Pour couronner le tout, les pompes sont tombées en panne en décembre-janvier 2012/2013 ; et la population n’avait accès à l’eau que très difficilement. De longues files d’attente se formaient auprès des puits de forage pour avoir un peu d’eau. Dans ces conditions, les plantes étaient menacées de mourir. Pire, les chasseurs de rongeurs ont fait un feu de brousse qui a dévoré une partie de nos jeunes pousses mises en terre tout au long du périmètre.

De juin 2013 à ce jour, nous sommes normalement en saison pluvieuse. Les pluies sont rares. Les pompes sont tombées en panne les unes après les autres et le village est dans l'impasse pour trouver de l'eau à boire... Sans interlocuteur et sans secours.

 

L’Association a du mal à maintenir sa pépinière et à créer cet espace vert protégé. Dans son programme d’activités pour l’année 2013, elle a accueilli en stage un étudiant en Master de l’environnement de l'université Bordeaux I qui a rejoint l’Association en Juillet 2013 pour apporter sa contribution au projet. Son diagnostic est le même que celui de l'association : il est urgent d'avoir de l'eau et de relancer le reboisement.


A QUOI SERVIRA LA COLLECTE ?

Le but de la présente collecte est de continuer et améliorer l'efficacité du programme de l'association :

  • avoir des ressources pour acheter, transporter et distribuer les jeunes pousses pour les campagnes 2013-2014. Coût estimé à 666 USD ;
  • forer un puits pour les besoins en eau du parc en gestation ; afin de soutenir l’activité de l’association en période de sécheresse. Coût estimé à 12663 USD ;
  • monter une clôture pour protéger le parc contre les feux de brousse, estimation 14930 USD .                                                            
  • Le coût total du programme en vue est estimé à 28259 USD. Les membres s’impliquent dans la mobilisation au Bénin, d’une prise de participation aux travaux s’élevant à 4000 USD. Nous espérons donc collecter 24259 USD.

Si la collecte est réussie, nous pourrons fournir davantage de plants à la population pour les campagnes 2013-2014, réaliser le forage et la clôture du domaine, gage de la pérénité du projet.

Tout surplus servira pour la réalisation des autres objectifs :

  • Sensibilisation des habitants à l’importance de la verdure pour le bien-être de l’homme ;
  • Création des différents espaces du jardin public ;
  • Mise en place d'une brigade d'assainissement du village ;
  • Sensibilisation autour d’alternatives à l’utilisation du charbon de bois en milieu domestique.

story:
Who are you Do-Gooders?

Do-Gooder is a group of friends who one day decided to create an entertainment company to inspire people to live a do-gooder life by holding corporations accountable and upholding human rights. To simultaneously fund our entertainment projects and support charities, we also sell really fun products.

We believe that all companies should operate on a level that makes the world a better place and we want to set that precedent and hold huge companies to the same. Do-Gooder is starting by donating 20% of the retail cost of all products sold to our beneficiaries. By donating a percentage of the retail price customers can know how much they are donating with simple, transparent math before clicking the "Buy" button for a dose of warm fuzzies. 

So Show Me the Goods

Our first product is this totally awesomesauce t-shirt featuring GX-47, the 7-Time Multitask Champion. Once produced, 20% of retail sales from this shirt will go to victims of toxic pollution in Ecuador and will come packaged in a neat Do-Gooder Oil can that you can reuse for other stuff.  100% cotton, XS - XL.


The next shirt is "Good Stopped Playing Nice", our Do-Gooder tag line. This thing is super soft and very comforatbale. It usually takes days of not washing, hiking, and cleaning on a rock to get a shirt this soft. 100% organic cotton, sizes XS - XL.


Our final shirt is the one that started it all: the Ecuador Hangman t-shirt. Loaded with Ecuador pollution info across the front with a very sexy chalkboard motif. Science has shown that wearing this shirt in public starts conversations and draws lots of positive attention. 100% cotton, sizes XS - XL.

 

What We Need

This round of funding is for our first printing of the GX-47 t-shirt so we can start supporting the people of Ecuador. Our goal is $2500 for the first run of shirts and marketing expenses (like ads, not bar tabs).

The Impact

When we formed Do-Gooder, we wanted to create a company that merged our passion for entertainment and retail, but also helped those in need. This first campaign will help ClearWater build rainwater catchment systems to provide fresh drinking water to Ecuadorians whose land and water supplies have been spoiled by decades of toxic dumping in their rainforests by major oil companies.

Other Ways to Help

Of course, what really matters are the people. While we'd love it if you supported Do-Gooder, we totally understand if you want to donate directly to ClearWater. You can go directly to ClearWater's website and donate to their cause.

Also, if you believe in Do-Gooder's goals as a company, please share this page with your friends on Twitter and Facebook. We'd really appreciate it!

Together, through ethical business and reaching out to those in need, we can make a difference in people's lives and in the way companies are run.

The Impact

When we formed Do-Gooder, we wanted to create a company that merged our passion for entertainment and retail, but also helped those in need. This first campaign will help ClearWater build rainwater catchment systems to provide fresh drinking water to Ecuadorians whose land and water supplies have been spoiled by decades of toxic dumping in their rainforests by major oil companies.
Other Ways to Help
Of course, what really matters are the people. While we'd love it if you supported Do-Gooder, we totally understand if you want to donate directly to ClearWater. You can go directly to ClearWater's website and donate to their cause. Also, if you believe in Do-Gooder's goals as a company, please share this page with your friends on Twitter and Facebook. We'd really appreciate it!
Together, through ethical business and reaching out to those in need, we can make a difference in people's lives and in the way companies are run.

story:
Short Summary

Greetings all,

My name is Regi Traven and I am a creator. I paint in oils, I draw, invent, write philosophy, and write poetry. My mind is in a near constant state of creativity, problem solving, and idealism. In addition, I have a passion for animals of ALL types. Occupationally, I've been in customer service and sales most of my life.

The Petfood Pump is a device we created to make feeding cats and dogs wet food more convenient in order to promote healthier feeding. I provide for 4 cats and take great care in making sure each have what they personally need. Feeding them gets expensive, especially for my youngest. She has skin problems and eating premium food has been the best remedy.

The Petfood Pump and Canister System, or "PPaCS" eliminates the need to spoon wet cat and dog food or wrap leftovers. Since that process is unnecessary, the pet provider can focus on proper portions to prevent obesity, especially in cats. If we are able to bring this to the market, pet providers will be able to utilize its practicality in many ways, but also be able to feed their pets premium wet food for much less than current costs. Our goal is to revolutionize feeding cats and dogs.  

    What We Need & What You Get

    We need funding to have molds and tools created to mass produce the Petfood Pump and the process is something that is completed in 8 to 12 weeks. In order to honor the perks for our contributors, we will use 3D molding to produce limited quantities of the Petfood Pump.  

    Having the Pet food produced through private labeling is much less expensive and can be completed in 4 weeks or less. It becomes a matter of charging less than the competitors for the same high quality. Companies deserve to make profits, but pets deserve to be healthy.

    We are asking for much less than we actually require, but if we reach our goal, we can still provide the premium grade pet food for our customers. In time, we can introduce the Petfood Pump and Canister System using our pet food profits. We simply have to get started. If our funds exceed our goals, we can begin to consider introducing the entire system and concepts right from the start. That is our true goal. 

    Our company will provide shoulder carry bags for cats and small dogs, pet feeding bowls, and pet supplies of all kinds. many of which can be used with the PPaCS to optimize convenience. Some of these will be offered as perks, but the Petfood Pump is the primary perk. If our funding is sufficient, we will add the PPaCS as a perk!!!

    If we fall short of our funding goal, we will still invest any received funds into our company; Pet Prize. We want to help pet providers care for their pets better.

     

    The Impact

    If you could store leftover pet food easier, aren't you less likely to overfeed or serve stale food? If you could buy better food cheaper, wouldn't you do so for your pet's overall well-being? We want to make pet feeding more practical. We also plan to partner with every adoption center that is willing, to incorporate our products into their promotions to help increase adoptions. One of the toughest things for me is seeing so many pets overlooked in these centers. With the PPaCS, I know we can help make a difference.

    I'm new to raising funds in this manner, and angel investors, small business loans, and innovation submission to companies are all exhausted options with no real success. All we need is financial backing and we will be able to do great things with our great ideas. True thanks for all your support.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I of all people know that not everyone has money to put towards anything external of their daily budget. If you support our campaign, you can also assist by letting others know about the PPaCS and what we are trying to accomplish for pet providers. And please use the communication tools set up by Indiegogo. Thanks for any and all of your support.

story:
Blue Dasher Farm Backers

We've made it past our initial campaign goal!  We could not have accomplished this major milestone without your support!  Continue to watch for updates on this page and our website:

Blue Dasher Farm Website


Blue Dasher Farm will be the first of a network of research, education, and demonstration farms to bring SCIENTIFIC SUPPORT to biodiverse food production.

Who are we?

We are scientists, farmers, bee keepers, and livestock producers who are embarking on an initiative that is going to make this planet a whole lot better. 

Dr. Jonathan Lundgren is an award winning scientist who studies entomology and agroecology. His work assesses the risks of pesticides to friendly species, and figures out how to use biodiversity (plants, animals, insects, microbes, etc.) to produce healthier food more profitably. His family and friends have helped him to establish an enthusiastic network of stakeholders around the country. 

Jenna Lundgren has a BS in Biology, expertise in business administration and community development, and a passionate belief that we must change the course of agricultural food production NOW.  She often says her children (and future grandchildren) are her motivation for getting this revolution started.

Together with family, friends, laboratory team, and colleagues, we are setting out to change how food is produced by redesigning farms in nature’s image.


The problem that Blue Dasher Farm will tackle.

The planet faces numerous challenges: climate change, invasive species, pollution, human health, and simplification of entire landscapes. Management of agroecosystems is central to solving many of these problems.

Why should you care? 

Decisions made on farms affect you, your family, and our way of life.

It all seems so big. But we at Blue Dasher are going to use our talents (and they are considerable!) to help turn this ship around.


What is Blue Dasher Farm trying to do?

To solve the many problems the planet is facing, we need a transformational shift in how we produce food and manage agroecosystems. These types of changes seldom come from the government or universities. Paradigm shifts start from the bottom up.

Over many years of visiting agricultural operations across the country, we quickly realized that there are some amazing farmers, ranchers, and bee keepers that are leading the charge. They are integrating livestock, annual, and perennial crops into multifaceted systems. They forgo monocultures, tillage, and bare soil. They generate multiple revenue streams within their operations, turning a profit while rebuilding soil and increasing diversity. Sadly, they are currently doing it with little scientific support.

Blue Dasher Farm’s role is to take what these innovators are doing and use research, education, and demonstration to disseminate the information to the next generation of scientists and food producers.

Our credibility, transparency, leadership, and vision make Blue Dasher Farm completely unique from anything else out there.


Initial Projects

    Helping to solve the honey bee problem. Humans cannot survive without pollinators, and honey production provides an additional revenue stream to farms and rangeland. We would like to develop biological controls for Varroa mite to reduce costly inputs and improve hive health, evaluate risks associated with pesticides to honey bees, and devise safe strategies for deploying bee forage within agroecosystems.

Bee Health Research at Blue Dasher Farm

    Improving diversity on rangeland. Rangeland occupies a tremendous footprint on North America.  We can use this habitat to foster biodiversity, reduce the impact of human activities on the environment, and produce healthy food. Projects investigating the importance of dung fauna on pasture health and the economics of cattle production, and how mob grazing systems can improve systems-level processes on rangeland are at the top of our research list.

Rangeland Research at Blue Dasher Farm

    Soil health and crop production. Many problems are associated with annual and perennial cropland. But management can improve this situation dramatically and profitably. Reducing disturbance like tillage and unnecessary pesticide use, and increasing diversity through the use of diverse crop rotations, intercropping (taking advantage of plant synergisms), and cover cropping (instead of leaving bare ground) are key research areas we want to explore. And figuring out how to maximize insect services like predation, weed herbivory, soil physical and chemical properties, and pollination will be a primary focus of research.

Cropland Biodiversity Research @ Blue Dasher Farm


Our Vision for the Future

The Deuel County location is just the beginning. We have a purchase agreement on a 53 acre farm with  facilities that will work for hosting courses and conducting laboratory research that is located right off of the I-29 corridor in eastern South Dakota. But we really need your help in order to take this farm and make it a place where research, education, and demonstration can thrive. Once the core location is established and staffed, it is our vision to establish a network of these research, education, demonstration farms across the country to address local and regional needs. As more and more farmers become ready to make the change to biodiverse farming, we want to have systems and strategies in place to remove informational gaps and lessen risks to their transition.

Where are your contributions going?

$75,000  Initial Laboratory set up

Laboratory supplies are crucial to our research operations.  Everything from microscopes, growth chambers, beakers, insect pins, sweep nets, and duct tape.....you name it, we'll need it!  

What happens if we surpass our initial campaign goal? (No worries, we have a plan!)

$100,000 level:   Hive equipment

Our bee health research is contingent on having a ready source of bee hives. We will purchase 75 hives; these hives will also be a great tool for introducing the concept of revenue stacking into current operations.

$225,000 level:  Farm equipment

We have a list of machinery (tractor, no-till drill, combine with picker head, spray rig, gravity wagons, etc.) that we need to make the farming operation profitable.

$400,000 level:  Laboratory set up (again)

Guess what? Cutting edge research is expensive, and we would like to purchase molecular and biochemical equipment to keep Blue Dasher Farm’s science on the front edge.

$1 million level:  Buyin’ the farm.

At this level, we can remove all debt financing for Blue Dasher Farm, and let us focus on changing the world.

$1.5 million level: Buyin’ an even better farm.

We would like to build a greenhouse facility to conduct year-round research, and a bunkhouse to more easily host immersion workshops on agroecology. We also envision purchasing another 150 acres of farm and rangeland in the area.

$5 million level: Independent research for life.

We will establish an endowment that can be used to support core personnel and base research activities for perpetuity. At this funding level, Blue Dasher Farm can continue to provide scientific support without fear of political or large agribusiness interference.

More than $5 million?

We will move forward with establishing the next research, education, and demonstration farms at strategic locations throughout the country. Sticking with our Dragonfly theme, will the next farm be called Slender Baskettail Farm? Scarlet Skimmer Farm? Banded Pennet Farm? Pondhawk Farm? There is no shortage of really cool dragonfly names. And if we are this successful, we’ll let you guys pick the name of the next one!


Additional Footage courtesy of Carbon Nation. Carbon Nation 2015

story:
We need your help to create something very special...... 37 acres of brand new rainforest adjoining the World Heritage listed Daintree National Park. We are three committed people determined to create a legacy, but we need your assistance to help fund and plant 70,000 rainforest trees in six stages, starting December 2015 with the first 10,000 trees, to further increase wildlife habitat in the most bio-diverse region of Australia.

NightWings is an ambitious and unique project. A property has been purchased south of the Daintree River in Far North Queensland, backing onto the World Heritage listed Daintree National Park: an area recognised as having the highest biodiversity rate in Australia. This 37 acre (15ha) site will encompass a small area for low impact, ecologically sustainable Visitor, Education and Interpretive Centre, and Bat Hospital. We envisage to also build a café and gift shop in the future once the revegetation is established. The majority of the land is being turned over to the exciting task of turning old cane farm into complex lowland rainforest, combined with forest walks for a stunning and authentic ecotourism experience. The site already contains mature and new rainforest planting, and transects have revealed a myriad of fauna, including 11 EVNT (Endangered, Vulnerable, & Near Threatened) listed species. Government transects have revealed at least 65 additional species of Mammals, Birds, Reptiles and Amphibians on this property.

This new 37 acre (15ha) project will provide extended new habitat for The Southern Cassowary, Bennett’s Tree Kangaroo, Grey Goshawk, Grey Falcon, Raja Shelduck, Rufous Owl, Ghost bat, Large-eared Horseshoe bat, the endangered Australian Lace-lid Frog, Spectacled Flying-fox and flora such as the vulnerably listed Black Palm.

Divided into planting stages over 6 years, the whole project will require over 70,000 trees to be planted. This will provide a fast-growing framework for animals to plant secondary seed direct from the surrounding forest. The first stage of 5.4 acres (2.2ha) (encompassing the visually-blended centre) will create a significant 60 metre wide corridor linking mature lowland rainforest to the mangroves at the Daintree River mouth for the first time in around 100 years.

Working with experts in regeneration like Rainforest Rescue, Douglas Shire Council and in consultation with the traditional Kuku Yalangi people, our aim is to create a centre of excellence in conservation, bat rehabilitation and ecologically diverse land management.

You can help be part of this significant project by donating a tree (or two or six or more). Stage 1 will be planted from December 2015 - March 2016, and will require 10,000 trees. Work has already begun on seed acquisition, germination and potting seedlings, but we still need to raise an additional $48,000 for the remaining required trees.

How We Will Use Your Contribution

As this land is old sugarcane fields it is going to require 3 stages of land preparation before the trees can be planted and will require ongoing weed control for at least 2 years after planting until established.

Every $10.00 will provide funds for this land preparation and the growth, watering, planting, weed control and maintenance of a tree. Each tree will provide just over one square metre of brand new rainforest.


Beech Almond Seedlings in our nursery.

About Us

We are Annie, Dave and Connie and together we have over 40 years experience in Wildlife Care and Rehabilitation, in particular specialising in Bats and Flying Foxes. We therefore fully understand the importance of providing suitable habitat for wildlife. Our aim is that by increasing the habitat of this ecologically diverse and valuable area, we will be able to provide new homes and feeding areas for many species of our local wildlife.

Our Future Vision

We will continue to liaise and work with organisations such as Rainforest Rescue and the Douglas Shire Council throughout all stages of this project. By providing the initial framework trees, we will provide the necessary requirements to bring in rainforest doves, cassowaries and other animals who will in turn bring in seed from the surrounding forests to rapidly increase species diversity, with the final aim being rich and complex mature lowland rainforest.

Connie inspecting some 2 year growth at a similar project.

How Can You Help Us?

Please share our project and needs far and wide with your family, friends and work colleagues. Remember, every single tree will create one square meter of rainforest for perpetuity. Alternatively you may wish to conduct a mini fundraiser with your family, workplace or neighbourhood, and donate the funds raised to our project.

In the future we will be opening the Centre to the public and would invite everyone to come and visit to see the growth and progress of your trees.

Every donor will receive a personalised electronic emailed certificate acknowledging your valued contribution.

For any enquiries, please do not hesitate to contact us on nightwings.centre@gmail.com

Thank you

Annie Schoenberger, Dave Pinson, Connie Kerr

story:
The Maya Bee

Centuries before the Spanish introduced European honey bees (Apis mellifera) to the Americas, Maya bee keepers harvested honey from the log nests of stingless bees native to tropical forests, the stingless Melipona bee (Melipona beecheii).

"For thousands of years, Mayas were expert practitioners of bee husbandry, and honey was an essential forest resource…as a sweetener, as an antibiotic and as an ingredient in the Maya version of mead. The Mayas, like other tropical forest cultures, worked with large-bodied meliponine bees that produce a variety of honeys. Their favorite, and one of the most productive species, has been Melipona beecheii, 'Xunan kab', which means, literally, 'royal lady',” said David Roubik, featured on the PBS "Deep Jungle" series.

The Honey Museum, to open in Mérida, Yucatán, will showcase the Maya honey—and all the products made from its honey.

These social bees collect honey and live in logwood hive. They do not have stingers and no venom. They have beautiful green eyes and Maya cooperatives throughout the Yucatán cultivate these bees and protect them.

  • We are based in the Yucatán
  • We are so close to raising the last of the funds we need to open the museum.
  • You contribution will save the Melipona bee, one of the most endangered bees in the Americas.
What We Need & What You Get

The Honey Museum:

  • We need to provide for the equipment necessary to help Maya villagers continue their traditional bee husbandry.
  • We need to purchase the fixtures to display the various honey products in the museum shop
  • We need to provide educational material--in Spanish, Maya, and English--to teach schoolchildren and Maya villagers about the role bees play in our environment
  • Supporters to our campaign will receive a jar of Maya honey, cultivated straight from the tropical forests of the Yucatán peninsula!
Our Work

The Honey Museum / El Museo de la Miel is dedicated to protecting the bees of  Yucatán and the Maya region:

  • The Melipona bee is threatened
  • The Museum will proved a fair trade environment for Maya villagers to sell the honey and honey products they cultivate
  • The Museum will be open to the public and will work to educate children about the need to protect the world in which we live



Risks & Challenges

 Protecting tropical habitats and the species that inhabit them is an urgent task. The Museum works towards that goal of educating and protecting.

  • For thousands of years the Maya have engaged in bee husbandry and we want to make sure that these traditions continue forward for generations to come
  • Erratic climate patterns makes it more urgent that steps be taken to educate the public and protect the bees

Ways You Can Help

If you are not able contribute, please help us spread the word!

  • Share with your friends and make some noise about our wonderful campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much!
story_txt:
The Maya Bee 

Centuries before the Spanish introduced European honey bees (Apis mellifera) to the Americas, Maya
bee keepers harvested honey from the log nests of stingless bees native to
tropical forests, the stingless Melipona bee (Melipona beecheii).
"For thousands of years, Mayas were expert practitioners of
bee husbandry, and honey was an essential forest resource…as a sweetener, as an
antibiotic and as an ingredient in the Maya version of mead. The Mayas, like
other tropical forest cultures, worked with large-bodied meliponine bees that
produce a variety of honeys. Their favorite, and one of the most productive
species, has been Melipona beecheii, 'Xunan kab', which means, literally,
'royal lady',” said David Roubik, featured on the PBS "Deep Jungle"
series.
The Honey Museum, to open in Mérida, Yucatán, will showcase the
Maya honey—and all the products made from its honey.
These
social bees collect honey and live in logwood hive. They do not have stingers
and no venom. They have beautiful green eyes and Maya cooperatives throughout
the Yucatán cultivate these bees and protect them.
 We are based in the Yucatán We are so close to raising the last of the funds we need to open the museum. You contribution will save the Melipona bee, one of the most endangered bees in the Americas.
   




What We Need & What You Get The Honey Museum:  We need to provide for the equipment necessary to help Maya villagers continue their traditional bee husbandry.  We need to purchase the fixtures to display the various honey products in the museum shop We need to provide educational material--in Spanish, Maya, and English--to teach schoolchildren and Maya villagers about the role bees play in our environment
Supporters to our campaign will receive a jar of Maya honey, cultivated straight from the tropical forests of the Yucatán peninsula!    




Our Work The Honey Museum / El Museo de la Miel is dedicated to protecting the bees of  Yucatán and the Maya region:  The Melipona bee is threatened The Museum will proved a fair trade environment for Maya villagers to sell the honey and honey products they cultivate The Museum will be open to the public and will work to educate children about the need to protect the world in which we live    


Risks & Challenges  Protecting tropical habitats and the species that inhabit them is an urgent task. The Museum works towards that goal of educating and protecting.  For thousands of years the Maya have engaged in bee husbandry and we want to make sure that these traditions continue forward for generations to come Erratic climate patterns makes it more urgent that steps be taken to educate the public and protect the bees   Ways You Can Help If you are not able contribute, please help us spread the word!  Share with your friends and make some noise about our wonderful campaign. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!   Thank you so much!

story:
For English, please scroll down.

Ποιοι είμαστε

Who we are

Το B2Green.gr διανύει ήδη το δεύτερο του έτος. Έπειτα από αρκετά χρόνια ενασχόλησης με το χώρο, αποφασίσαμε να ακολουθήσουμε το όραμα μας για ένα καλύτερο αύριο: να δημιουργήσουμε μια διαδικτυακή πλατφόρμα, με σκοπό την προώθηση των πράσινων τεχνολογιών.

Στόχος μας ήταν και παραμένει η δημιουργία ενός online σημείου αναφοράς για όλους εσάς: τους ενδιαφερόμενους και μη ειδικούς, τους φοιτητές, τους επαγγελματίες, αλλά και τους φορείς, τα ιδρύματα και τους επιστήμονες του χώρου.

Οι βασικοί άξονες που ακολουθήσαμε κατά το ξεκίνημα μας, ήταν:

  • η φιλοξενία σχετικών άρθρων, δικών μας αλλά και αναδημοσιεύσεων
  • η δημιουργία επαγγελματικού καταλόγου (ήδη συμπεριλαμβάνονται περισσότεροι από 800 επαγγελματίες του χώρου)
  • η ανάπτυξη online εφαρμογής μέσω της οποίας συνδέονται μεταξύ τους οι επισκέπτες της σελίδας με τους εγγεγραμμένους επαγγελματίες χωρίς καμία χρέωση
  • η δημιουργία newsletter το οποίο μετά από μικρό χρονικό διάστημα έγινε καθημερινό (B2Green.gr Daily Report).

B2Green.gr is already in its second year. After several years of involvement in the field, we decided to follow our vision for a better future and create an online platform, dedicated to green technologies.

Our goal was and remains to create an integrated online platform for everyone: specialists or not, professionals, college & university students, and of course, green technology scientists & institutions.

The main axes that we followed so far were:

  • hosting related articles
  • creating a professional directory (already includes more than 800 professionals)
  • developing an online RFQ service, through which we provide our visitors the opportunity to connect with subscribed professionals without any charge
  • creating a daily newsletter (B2Green.gr Daily Report).

Η ανταπόκριση σας ήταν πέρα από κάθε προσδοκία! Μέσα σε ένα μόλις έτος, καταφέραμε να καθιερωθούμε στις κορυφαίες θέσεις των ιστοσελίδων του χώρου στην Ελλάδα!

Επιπλέον, στο μικρό αυτό χρονικό διάστημα, είχαμε ενεργή συμμετοχή ως εκθέτες και χορηγοί επικοινωνίας σε περισσότερες από 10 εκθέσεις και συνέδρια του χώρου, όπου μας δόθηκε η δυνατότητα να έρθουμε σε επαφή με εσάς, τους αναγνώστες μας, να γνωριστούμε από κοντά, να ανταλλάξουμε ιδέες και απόψεις για το χώρο μας και να καταγράψουμε τις δικές σας προτάσεις, επιθυμίες και ανάγκες, με σκοπό να τις ενσωματώσουμε στα επόμενα μας βήματα.

Your response was far beyond our expectations! Within just one year, we managed to establish B2Green.gr between the top Greek websites with related content.

Moreover, in this short time, we had active participation as exhibitors and media partners in more than 10 related exhibitions and conferences, where we had the chance to get in touch with you – our readers, to exchange ideas and opinions for our common interests and to write down your suggestions, wishes and needs, in order to integrate them within our next steps.

Τι είναι το "B2Green-pedia"

What is "B2Green-pedia"

Σήμερα, έπειτα από σχεδόν ενάμισι χρόνο, νιώθουμε πως τα σχέδια μας (που δεν είναι λίγα), δε μπορούν να περιμένουν άλλο! Το νέο project που θα τρέξουμε μέσα από τη σελίδα μας είναι το B2Green-pedia, η 1η online ενημερωτική - εκπαιδευτική εγκυκλοπαίδεια, εστιασμένη στις πράσινες τεχνολογίες και το περιβάλλον!

Σκοπός μας για το B2Green-pedia είναι να αποτελέσει ταυτόχρονα:

  • Πηγή έγκυρης πληροφόρησης για κάθε ενδιαφερόμενο που δεν είναι ειδικός στο χώρο, με απλή – κατανοητή γλώσσα για όλους
  • Πλατφόρμα αναφοράς και ενημέρωσης σε εξειδικευμένα θέματα, για τους επαγγελματίες, τους επιστήμονες και τους φοιτητές του χώρου

Today, after nearly a year & a half, we feel that our plans (which are not few), can not wait any longer! Our new project that will run through our page is B2Green-pedia, the first online information - educational encyclopedia, focused on green and environmental technologies!

Our aim for B2Green-pedia is to become at the same time:

  • Valid information source of for everyone, written in a simple - understandable language
  • Reference information platform on specialized topics for professionals, academics and students.

Κατηγορίες του B2Green-pedia - Categories

Σε πλήρη ανάπτυξη, το B2Green-pedia θα φιλοξενεί:

  • Παρουσιάσεις των πράσινων τεχνολογιών σε απλή γλώσσα, κατανοητή από όλους
  • Αναλυτικές και εξειδικευμένες τεχνολογικές παρουσιάσεις, διαβαθμισμένες σε επίπεδο κατανόησης
  • Πλεονεκτήματα – μειονεκτήματα και σύγκριση τεχνολογιών
  • Παραδείγματα εφαρμογής και τρόπους υπολογισμού
  • Δημοσιεύσεις σχετικών μελετών και εργασιών από οργανισμούς, φορείς κλπ.
  • Διατριβές, συγγράμματα, πτυχιακές – διπλωματικές εργασίες
  • Σχετική νομοθεσία
  • Θέσεις εργασίας στο χώρο και βιογραφικά υποψηφίων

Τα κείμενα θα υπογράφουν εξειδικευμένοι επιστήμονες του χώρου, καθηγητές τριτοβάθμιας εκπαίδευσης, διακεκριμένοι επαγγελματίες κλπ.

When completed, B2Green-pedia will host:

  • Green technology presentations, written in a simple language so that everyone could understand
  • Detailed and specialized presentations, in a comprehension rating scale
  • Advantages - disadvantages and technology comparison
  • Application examples and calculation methods
  • Related studies by organizations, theses and books by colleges, universities, scientists etc.
  • Green technology legislation
  • Job opportunities in the field – candidates resumes

All articles will be written by skilled scientists in the field, university professors, distinguished professionals etc.

Γιατί crowsfunding

Why crowdfunding

Ο στόχος της υλοποίησης του B2Green-pedia γεννήθηκε στις σκέψεις μας, σχεδόν από την πρώτη μέρα του B2Green.gr. Το ποσό όμως που απαιτείται για την ολοκλήρωση του νέου αυτού project υπερβαίνει τις οικονομικές μας δυνατότητες.

Η μέχρι σήμερα προσπάθεια μας βασίζεται αποκλειστικά στις δικές μας δυνάμεις, χωρίς να έχουμε λάβει καμία επιδότηση, κρατική επιχορήγηση ή χρηματοδότηση από τρίτους.

Ως γνωστόν, η οικονομική ύφεση – χωρίς να είναι η μόνη υπαίτια – έχει πλήξει τα μέγιστα τις υπηρεσίες προβολής και διαφήμισης, οι οποίες αποτελούν το μοναδικό μας έσοδο. Η μόνη μας επιλογή για να καλύψουμε μέρος του κόστους, είναι να απευθυνθούμε σε εκείνους που μας στήριξαν από την αρχή, με την αποδοχή τους: σε εσάς!

Το περιεχόμενο του B2Green.gr όπως γνωρίζετε ήδη, παρέχεται δωρεάν, και έτσι θα συνεχίσει. Για να προχωρήσουμε όμως στην υλοποίηση του B2Green-pedia, χρειαζόμαστε την ενίσχυση σας. Το ποσό που απαιτείται για την υλοποίηση του – σε πλήρη ανάπτυξη – είναι σημαντικά μεγαλύτερο του στόχου που θέσαμε στο indiegogo. Το project θα υλοποιηθεί έτσι κι αλλιώς, ανεξαρτήτως επίτευξης του στόχου – η συνεισφορά σας όμως θα μας βοηθήσει για να το ολοκληρώσουμε ταχύτερα και πληρέστερα.

Τα ανταλλάγματα που σας προσφέρουμε για τη συνεισφορά σας όπως μπορείτε να δείτε, είναι μοναδικά, μιας και έχουν σχέση με την υπάρχουσα επιτυχημένη σελίδα μας, B2Green.gr. Μπορείτε να συνεισφέρετε με ποσά που ξεκινούν από μόλις 10 ευρώ, ενώ μπορείτε να επιλέξετε ανταλλάγματα που σας ενδιαφέρουν, είτε είσαστε επαγγελματίες του χώρου, είτε φοιτητές, είτε ακόμα και αν απλά ενδιαφέρεστε για τις πράσινες τεχνολογίες και το περιβάλλον.

The implementation of B2Green-pedia is in our mind since B2Green.gr's day one! Unfortunately, the amount required for the completion of this new project exceeds our financial capabilities.

Until today, we have been relying on our own strength, without having received any government grant or third parties funding.

As you know, economic downturn - without being the only fault - hits crucially promotional and advertising services, which are our only income. Our only option to cover just a part of the cost, is to reach out to those who have supported us from the very beginning with their acceptance: you!

The content of B2Green.gr as you already know, is totally free, and so it will be in the future. In order to develop B2Green-pedia, we need your aid. The amount needed to implement - in full growth - is significantly higher than the target we set at indiegogo. The project will be regardless of achieving our target - but your contribution will help us to make it better and finish sooner.

The rewards we offer for your contribution, as you can see, are unique, since they are related to our successful existing website B2Green.gr. You can contribute with amounts starting from just € 10 and you can choose rewards that interest you, whether you are professional, student, or even if you are just interested in green and environmental technologies.

Που θα χρησιμοποιηθούν τα χρήματα

Where the money will be used

Το B2Green-pedia δε χρειάζεται πόρους μόνο για την ολοκλήρωση του αλλά και για τη διαρκή του ενημέρωση, τροφοδότηση με ότι νεότερο εμφανίζεται στο χώρο, συντήρηση κλπ.

Τα χρήματα που θα συγκεντρωθούν θα χρησιμοποιηθούν για:

  • υλικοτεχνικό εξοπλισμό (Η/Υ, αναβάθμιση servers κλπ)
  • πρόσληψη επιπλέον προσωπικού (αυτό και μόνο αξίζει της στήριξης σας)
  • κόστος προγραμματισμού και δημιουργίας της νέας πλατφόρμας
  • κόστος γραφιστικού υλικού και δημιουργικού
  • κόστος πνευματικών δικαιωμάτων
  • κόστος προώθησης και προβολής του B2Green-pedia
  • κόστος διατήρησης και συνεχούς – καθημερινής ενημέρωσης
  • κόστη μετάφρασης
  • φορολογικά έξοδα

B2Green-pedia needs funding, in order not only to complete but also to keep it up to date, cover maintenance expenses etc.

The money raised will be used to:

  • technical equipment (pc network, server upgrade etc. )
  • hiring additional staff (if only this one deserves your support )
  • development cost
  • graphic designer cost
  • copyright cost
  • B2Green-pedia's promotional cost
  • maintenance and daily updating cost
  • translation cost
  • tax expenditures

Εναλλακτικοί τρόποι υποστήριξης

Other ways to support us

Ακόμα και αν δεν έχετε τη δυνατότητα να συνεισφέρετε οικονομικά, υπάρχουν και άλλοι τρόποι να μας βοηθήσετε. Θα είμαστε βαθύτατα υποχρεωμένοι απέναντι σας, αν:

  • προωθήσετε την προσπάθεια μας σε κάθε συνάδελφο, συμφοιτητή, γνωστό και φίλο που πιστεύετε πως τον ενδιαφέρει το project
  • μοιραστείτε την καμπάνια μας στα social media
  • χρησιμοποιήσετε τα εργαλεία του indiegogo για να κάνετε γνωστή την προσπάθεια μας

Even if you are not able to contribute financially, there are other ways to help us. We would be deeply obliged to you if you could:
  • forward our project in every colleague, classmate or friend, you believe that he/she would be interested
  • share our campaign on social media
  • use indiegogo tools to promote our effort

Σας ευχαριστούμε όλους για την υποστήριξη

Thank you for your support

B2Green

Η μέχρι σήμερα προσπάθεια μας βασίζεται αποκλειστικά στις δικές μας δυνάμεις, χωρίς να έχουμε λάβει καμία επιδότηση, κρατική επιχορήγηση ή χρηματοδότηση από τρίτους.
Ως γνωστόν, η οικονομική ύφεση – χωρίς να είναι η μόνη υπαίτια – έχει πλήξει τα μέγιστα τις υπηρεσίες προβολής και διαφήμισης, οι οποίες αποτελούν το μοναδικό μας έσοδο. Η μόνη μας επιλογή για να καλύψουμε μέρος του κόστους, είναι να απευθυνθούμε σε εκείνους που μας στήριξαν από την αρχή, με την αποδοχή τους: σε εσάς!
Το περιεχόμενο του B2Green.gr όπως γνωρίζετε ήδη, παρέχεται δωρεάν, και έτσι θα συνεχίσει. Για να προχωρήσουμε όμως στην υλοποίηση του B2Green-pedia, χρειαζόμαστε την ενίσχυση σας. Το ποσό που απαιτείται για την υλοποίηση του – σε πλήρη ανάπτυξη – είναι σημαντικά μεγαλύτερο του στόχου που θέσαμε στο indiegogo. Το project θα υλοποιηθεί έτσι κι αλλιώς, ανεξαρτήτως επίτευξης του στόχου – η συνεισφορά σας όμως θα μας βοηθήσει για να το ολοκληρώσουμε ταχύτερα και πληρέστερα.
Τα ανταλλάγματα που σας προσφέρουμε για τη συνεισφορά σας όπως μπορείτε να δείτε, είναι μοναδικά, μιας και έχουν σχέση με την υπάρχουσα επιτυχημένη σελίδα μας, B2Green.gr. Μπορείτε να συνεισφέρετε με ποσά που ξεκινούν από μόλις 10 ευρώ, ενώ μπορείτε να επιλέξετε ανταλλάγματα που σας ενδιαφέρουν, είτε είσαστε επαγγελματίες του χώρου, είτε φοιτητές, είτε ακόμα και αν απλά ενδιαφέρεστε για τις πράσινες τεχνολογίες και το περιβάλλον.
The implementation of B2Green-pedia is in our mind since B2Green.gr's day one! Unfortunately, the amount required for the completion of this new project exceeds our financial capabilities.
Until today, we have been relying on our own strength, without having received any government grant or third parties funding.
As you know, economic downturn - without being the only fault - hits crucially promotional and advertising services, which are our only income. Our only option to cover just a part of the cost, is to reach out to those who have supported us from the very beginning with their acceptance: you!
The content of B2Green.gr as you already know, is totally free, and so it will be in the future. In order to develop B2Green-pedia, we need your aid. The amount needed to implement - in full growth - is significantly higher than the target we set at indiegogo. The project will be regardless of achieving our target - but your contribution will help us to make it better and finish sooner.
The rewards we offer for your contribution, as you can see, are unique, since they are related to our successful existing website B2Green.gr. You can contribute with amounts starting from just € 10 and you can choose rewards that interest you, whether you are professional, student, or even if you are just interested in green and environmental technologies.
Που θα χρησιμοποιηθούν τα χρήματα
Where the money will be used
Το B2Green-pedia δε χρειάζεται πόρους μόνο για την ολοκλήρωση του αλλά και για τη διαρκή του ενημέρωση, τροφοδότηση με ότι νεότερο εμφανίζεται στο χώρο, συντήρηση κλπ.
Τα χρήματα που θα συγκεντρωθούν θα χρησιμοποιηθούν για:

υλικοτεχνικό εξοπλισμό (Η/Υ, αναβάθμιση servers κλπ)
πρόσληψη επιπλέον προσωπικού (αυτό και μόνο αξίζει της στήριξης σας)
κόστος προγραμματισμού και δημιουργίας της νέας πλατφόρμας
κόστος γραφιστικού υλικού και δημιουργικού
κόστος πνευματικών δικαιωμάτων
κόστος προώθησης και προβολής του B2Green-pedia
κόστος διατήρησης και συνεχούς – καθημερινής ενημέρωσης
κόστη μετάφρασης
φορολογικά έξοδα
B2Green-pedia needs funding, in order not only to complete but also to keep it up to date, cover maintenance expenses etc.
The money raised will be used to:

technical equipment (pc network, server upgrade etc. )
hiring additional staff (if only this one deserves your support )
development cost
graphic designer cost
copyright cost
B2Green-pedia's promotional cost
maintenance and daily updating cost
translation cost
tax expenditures

Εναλλακτικοί τρόποι υποστήριξης
Other ways to support us
Ακόμα και αν δεν έχετε τη δυνατότητα να συνεισφέρετε οικονομικά, υπάρχουν και άλλοι τρόποι να μας βοηθήσετε. Θα είμαστε βαθύτατα υποχρεωμένοι απέναντι σας, αν:

προωθήσετε την προσπάθεια μας σε κάθε συνάδελφο, συμφοιτητή, γνωστό και φίλο που πιστεύετε πως τον ενδιαφέρει το project
μοιραστείτε την καμπάνια μας στα social media
χρησιμοποιήσετε τα εργαλεία του indiegogo για να κάνετε γνωστή την προσπάθεια μας
Even if you are not able to contribute financially, there are other ways to help us. We would be deeply obliged to you if you could:

forward our project in every colleague, classmate or friend, you believe that he/she would be interested
share our campaign on social media
use indiegogo tools to promote our effort

Σας ευχαριστούμε όλους για την υποστήριξη
Thank you for your support
B2Green

story:
#JoinHANDS and say NO to filthy fuels and YES to clean energy. 

Help create our BIGGEST global event yet on May 17th by donating $1 or more!

On April 20, 2010 the Deepwater Horizon offshore drilling rig exploded into flames, killing 11 people. Over the course of 87 days, 200 million gallons of oil dumped into the Gulf of Mexico. Countless birds, fish, and marine mammals were harmed or killed, our beaches were ruined, residents were sickened, fishermen and tourist-driven businesses were devastated, and tens of thousands of cleanup workers were exposed to hazardous chemicals on a daily basis.

Four years later, the Gulf Coast is still recovering from Deepwater Horizon. We decided things have to change, that’s why we bring people together around the world to join hands to say NO to filthy fuels and YES to clean energy.

We are Hands Across the Sand, a global grassroots movement to champion clean energy solutions to our filthy fuels problem.

Every year, across the globe, we join hands with our friends, family and neighbors to support clean, renewable energy and a sustainable future for our planet.

For the past four years, Hands gatherings have brought thousands of people together worldwide, to gather on our beaches, rivers, parks and capitol steps. To draw our line in the sand—to stand up for the kind of planet we want to live in and leave to our children.

Hands Across the Sand is a movement made of people of all walks of life and knows no political, geographic or social boundaries. This movement is not about politics — it is about the protection of our coastal economies, oceans, wildlife, fisheries, and the places we cherish. The ongoing damage from oil drilling accidents, chemical leaks, coal ash spills, fracking, mountain top removal, tar sands mining, and climate change are a threat to our oceans and our way of life.

The fifth annual Hands Across the Sand will be held at Noon, in your location, on May 17, 2014. People all over the world will join hands to fight for our future. We need your help to make an even greater impact this year.

Here’s what you can do to be a part of the solution:

  1. Take the Pledge.

    You can say NO to dirty fuels, and YES to clean energy by attending an event on May 17.  Take the pledge now to host an event or find one to attend near you at http://handsacrossthesand.org.  It is easy to host an event and we have the resources to help make yours a success. The outcome of Hands is entirely dependent on dedicated people like you, who can make a difference by organizing events and getting the word out about Hands Across the Sand.

  2. Donate to the cause, even if just $1.

    Hands is a truly grassroots event, but we still have costs. You can be a part of the solution, by donating to help us meet our $10,000 goal so that we can host more events,boost our social media outreach, make a bigger impact, and even have some money to get started with next year too. Please give what you are able to, even if it’s just $1, but also check out the perks we have available for those who give more. For every dollar that we exceed our goal, we will be able to make this year even bigger.
  3. Spread the word.

    Tell your friends, family, and everyone you can about this fundraising campaign and the global events taking place on May 17. Invite everyone you can think of who might like to participate in a Hands Across the Sand event and make sure to invite media and elected officials like your mayor and city councilors. “Like” Hands Across the Sand on Facebook and share our posts to help spread the word.

Remember, YOU can make a difference. Be part of the solution.

We could not function without the assistance from our sponsors; Oceana, Surfrider Foundation, Sierra Club, Southern Alliance for Clean Energy, Chart 411, Gulf Restoration Network and Center for a Sustainable Coast. We have many partners that assist us in organizing as well, like Urban Paradise Guild and All things Healing.

story:
IN A WORD...  WE DID IT!

This campaign is about working to protect and restore the forests of Chios that were destroyed by fire last August, 2012.  You have supported it by helping us fund the purchase of a multi-purpose vehicle for TEAM OMIKRON so that it can get its people and equipment to where they are needed.  

Η προσπάθεια αυτή είναι για την προστασία και αποκατάσταση των δασικών εκτάσεων της Χίου που κάηκαν τον περασμένο Αύγουστο.  Ολοί όσοι συνέβαλλαν βοήθησαν να πάρουμε στην ΟΜΑΔΑ ΟΜΙΚΡΟΝ ένα όχημα πολλαπλών χρήσεων ώστε να μεταφέρουν ό,τι χρειάζεται (κόσμο / εργαλεία κλπ) στα σημεία δράσης.

 

WHO WE ARE

CHIOS NATURE is a not-for-profit company founded in London in 2005.  We have been working since then to protect and preserve the wildlife of the Greek islands of Chios, Oinousses and Psara.

We produce high-quality educational materials for local schools, and run an annual Wildlife Photography Competition that promotes awareness of the natural riches of the islands.  We also campaign on specific issues (e.g. for the protection of wild orchids; against environmentally damaging developments etc.) on a case-by-case basis, as the need arises. 

We keep over 1,000 supporters updated about environmental issues that affect "our" islands through regular posts on our Facebook page, and offer a wealth of wildlife images and information on our website, in both Greek and English...

www.chiosnature.org

 

THE PROBLEM: A DEVASTATING FOREST FIRE

On the 18th of August 2012, a small fire started in the mountains near the centre of Chios.  The fierce northerly winds blowing that night whipped the flames into an inferno that raged out of control for six days.  By the time it was finally extinguished, the fire had destroyed 36,000 acres of forest and farmland.   Many hundreds of the island's unique mastic bushes were lost, along with scrubland, olive groves, vineyards, crops, farm animals and wildlife.  In all, about one-fifth of the island turned to ash.  The scenes in our video were shot while the fire was still burning and in the days immediately following. Luckily, nobody was killed, but thousands of dead pine trees now stand like grey guardians of the blackened slopes. 

WHAT WE'RE GOING TO DO ABOUT IT: TOGETHER WE WILL TURN THOSE SLOPES GREEN AGAIN

Here's how...

Since the fire, Chios Nature has received many messages from people that love the island asking what they can do to support restoration work.  We were already investigating opportunities.  Since we have very little money ourselves, and neither equipment nor personnel, it initially appeared we might be powerless to help.  But thankfully, there are...

...the brilliant VOLUNTEERS!

 

 

Specifically, TEAM OMIKRON www.omikron.org.gr - a group of committed local people, now about 100 strong - is ready, willing and able.  It has been running successful fire-spotting, fire-fighting, clearing and reafforestation programmes all over Chios since 1999.  Highly motivated, well-managed and admired by both the Forestry Service and the professional Fire Brigade, this group is greatly valued by the local authorities because of its proven track record.  But it, too, is chronically short of funds. This means the team is constantly struggling to work at its full potential.  One of the greatest challenges it faces is in the transportation of its people and gear.

That's why CHIOS NATURE launched this campaign and asked its friends and supporters to join us in helping TEAM OMIKRON to get a vital piece of equipment - A MULTI-PURPOSE VEHICLE.  (In England we call it a "van").

GETTING A VAN TO A MAN THAT CAN

At CHIOS NATURE we believe in reinforcing success.  We also think that we should not try to reinvent the wheel.  So we're not setting up yet another new group to do reafforestation work - we already know "a man that can"  (and lots of women too).  And WITH YOUR SUPPORT we are going to help them do it even more effectively.  Here's the plan:

WE GIVE THEM THE TOOLS...

                                ... AND THEY GET THE JOB DONE

The group's volunteers will use the new van this campaign will provide, to transport what they need, to where they need it:  tools & equipment, personnel, seedlings, even a tank full of water will be able to be delivered to any location on the island that can be reached by road.  The people of OMIKRON will be our hands on the ground, greening the hillsides again.

Under the guidance of the Forestry Service, OMIKRON have already collected seeds that they will be planting this Spring to produce the saplings that, in a year or two, they will use to create new plantations of pines and other native species. Once the volunteers have planted the young trees, they will protect them (by fencing) from grazing herds, water and care for them until they become established.

In the meantime, they are pruning and clearing dry undergrowth from surviving forests, to stop future fires from being able to spread quickly, and supporting the work that has already begun to prevent the soil erosion that so often follows an intense fire. 

In a natural process that may seem less dramatic than the fire itself, but is no less damaging, precious soil gets washed down into the sea when it rains, carrying with it vital nutrients and any viable seeds that might have survived the flames.  

Anti-erosion measures are a top priority...  New trees must have soil to grow in!  Some work is already underway, as you can see from the image below - but the scale of the task is simply huge.  So OMIKRON need all the help we can give them.

THE WAY FORWARD

OMIKRON have identified a number of pre-owned vans that would suit their needs.  The amount (16,500 euro) we are aiming to collect, will cover the cost of buying one of these on the Greek mainland and transporting it by ferry to Chios.

CHIOS NATURE is acting as coordinator of this effort, but none of the funds you pledge will be retained by us - they will all be channelled to TEAM OMIKRON. 

If there is any money left over from the purchase of the van, we will use it to buy as much additional equipment as we can.  That means things like: chain saws, gloves, protective work gear etc. and give that to the volunteers as well. (They'll even have something to carry it all around in)!

For the lovely people that decide to pledge funds to this project we have put together a range of "goodies" that we will send you, according to the level of your contribution.  If you have chosen a "perk" make sure we also have a postal address for you!

We also plan to make a short film about the work of OMIKRON, so that you will be able to see not only the mighty van itself in action, but also the many facets of the work that the team does to protect and restore the landscapes of Chios.  We have started collecting footage for this, even though the van has not yet been bought.

FINALLY... A GREAT, BIG

"THANK YOU"

TO YOU, FOR BEING PART OF THE EFFORT TO RESTORE THE FIRE-DAMAGED LANDSCAPES OF CHIOS AND TO TURN THE HILLSIDES GREEN AGAIN.
