Pledge $1,500 or more (only 2 of these): An original painting by TerraBluTeam Founder, artist Vera Struck
These 48” x 48” exquisite fine art originals on canvas are entitled “Tuscan Dreamer #1” and “Tuscan Dreamer #2”. Their value is $2,500@.

Pledge $5,000 or more: Donor Recognition Wall
Your name listed on artist designed donor recognition wall in hallway of completed Project Building, and all previous tiers except the $1,500 category.
All larger tiers and their perks are listed here.
If you are in or near Ipswich, MA., want to volunteer, help with interns or be an intern, do not hesitate to reach us at vera@blucirclezeroplus.com.
All perks will be delivered when funding is received with the following exceptions: The Getting to Zero Book & DVD (written as the project is being constructed), free nights at the Getting to Zero AirBNB, private tours and Opening Party Invite obviously cannot be delivered until construction is completed.
 
Relevant perk link with higher donor categories:
http://terrabluteams.org/getting-to-zero-project/
 
Other Ways you can help:
Please help us spread the word. Share our campaign with your family and friends that care about sustainability, art, organic gardening, culture, education, food, health, and helping the community of Ipswich, MA., on its quest for sustainability (while helping the Earth and humanity)!
Please send this link to other people who may be able to donate or share the link on Facebook, Twitter or LinkedIn.

story:
Project EMS00X – Environmental Measuring Station

  • The project explained in few lines
    This project focuses on the development of two environmental monitoring stations. One is fixed at the ground and another is a mobile unmanned vehicle. The stations will measure values such as radioactivity in the area, or atmospheric pollution. The mobile station will be effectively an autonomous drone (UAV). Once the project is completed, we will release via internet the schemes for the realization of this two stations. We will release all completely free of charge(open source), also if we can get a sufficient budget we will also open an e-commerce where you can buy both stations preassembled.

  • Why Open Source?
    Open source because this type of technology should be free.
    Anyone should be able to benefit from the time and resources that we have used in this project.
    Universities, research laboratories, private companies and hobbyists will be able to access the schemes and code for replicating this project. They will be able to replicate the project, in order to build their own drone, by following the schemes and they will by able to do in a low cost way.

    Our opinion is that in this era we need to share and collaborate. We need unity and mutual help. No secrets or closing. For this reason, this project is, and must remain, open source.

    You do not know what is Open Source Hardware? You are not informed about the initiatives related to Open Source Hardware? Then watch this video! It is one of our sources of inspiration.
    http://youtu.be/jklVbLQjWXs (Marcin Jakubowski: open source projects for machinery)

  • What the final purpose of the project?
    This is a project that wants to help anyone who is interested in studying certain environments, and this applies also to the environment that surrounds him in person. Considering the fact that one of the key parts of this project is an UAV drone, it is possible to formulate a sentence like this: << The aim is to help the human being to study in safety the places considered "at risk" without having to expose themselves in first person. The technology does not exists just to make our lives more comfortable, but exist also to help us to study the environment around us in complete safety, and also to help prevent damage to the human being itself. >>

    When the project is completed we will open a website that provides all the schemes necessary for the construction of both stations, the drone and the ground station. Will be provided both hardware schematics and the code necessary software side.
    In addition, if we raise sufficient funds will open an online shop that will sell both stations preassembled and working. ( But we will continue to recommend DIY: build by yourself any of the two measuring stations, lead you to better understand of the same, and also during the construction process you will be able to apply any kind of customization and editing)

  • How to help this project to become a reality?
    This project can become a reality only with the help of each of you. If what I wrote has touched you, if you think this project are worthy of note, if you want to help us, please make a donation.

    We calculated that to complete this project properly, without shortcuts, we need 24000 euros. I and my team want to see this project finished and working. We want to see it fly, we want to see it helps people. We want to give our little contribution to what is humanity today. Although it is a very small contribution. We would love to see this drone fly and helping people to make all the measurements of the case in places " dangerous." So we decided that we will start working on the project even if we manage to collect a lot less money: we want to invest our time and our resources in this project. We decided that if we collect 6500 euros in any case we will start the work. For this we have set 6500 euros as a target of the campaign.

    Any help, even a small help, is really important to us. And any help will be rewarded.

    I want to repeat myself: we need you to make this project become a reality .

Project EMS00X – Environmental Measuring Station

  • Il progetto spiegato in poche righe
    Questo progetto è incentrato sullo sviluppo di una stazione di misurazione ambientale fissa ed una mobile. Le stazioni misureranno valori come la radioattività della zona, o l'inquinamento atmosferico. La stazione mobile sarà a tutti gli effetti un drone autonomo(UAV). Una volta completato il progetto verranno rilasciati pubblicamente in maniera completamente gratuita gli schemi per la realizzazione dello stesso(open source), inoltre se riusciremo ad ottenere un budget sufficiente verrà aperto anche un e-commerce dove sarà possibile acquistare entrambe le stazioni di misurazione ambientale.

  • Come mai Open Source?
    Open source perché questo tipo di tecnologia deve essere libero.
    Chiunque deve poter beneficiare del tempo e delle risorse che abbiamo impiegato in questo progetto.
    Università, laboratori di ricerca, privati, aziende ed hobbisti avranno la possibilità di accedere agli schemi ed al codice per replicare questo progetto. Potranno replicare il loro progetto seguendo gli schemi e avendo dei costi bassi e contenuti.

    Secondo noi in questo periodo storico abbiamo bisogno di condividere e di collaborare. Di unirci e di aiutarci. Non di segreti o chiusura. Per questo motivo questo progetto è, e deve restare, open source.

    Non sai cosa è l'Hardware Open Source? Non sei informato sulle iniziative legate al Hardware Open Source? Allora guarda questo video! Si tratta di una delle nostre fonti di ispirazione.http://youtu.be/jklVbLQjWXs ( Marcin Jakubowski: Progetti per macchinari open source )

  • Quale è lo scopo finale del progetto?
    Questo è un progetto che vuole aiutare chiunque sia interessato, a studiare determinati ambienti, e questo vale anche per l'ambiente che lo circonda in prima persona. Considerando il fatto che una delle parti chiave di questo progetto è un drone UAV, è possibile formulare una sentenza di questo tipo: <<Lo scopo è aiutare l'essere umano a studiare in sicurezza i luoghi considerati a “rischio” senza doversi esporre in prima linea.La tecnologia non esiste solo per rendere più comode le nostre vite, ma anche per aiutarci a studiare l'ambiente che ci circonda in piena sicurezza, anche per aiutarci a prevenire danni all'essere umano stesso.>>

    Quando il progetto sarà completato verrà aperto un sito che fornirà tutti gli schemi necessari alla costruzione sia del drone di misurazione, sia della stazione fissa. Verranno forniti sia gli schemi hardware, sia il codice necessario lato software.
    Inoltre, se riusciremo a raccogliere sufficienti fondi verrà aperto uno shop online che vedrà entrambi le stazioni preassemblate e funzionanti (Ma continueremo a consigliare il D.I.Y: costruire la stazione di misurazione da se', che sia mobile o fissa, aiuta a comprenderne meglio il funzionamento, inoltre durante il processo di costruzione sarà possibile applicare ogni tipo di personalizzazione e modifica).

  • Come aiutare questo progetto a diventare realtà?
    Questo progetto può diventare una realtà di fatto solo con l'aiuto di ciascuno di voi. Se quanto ho scritto vi ha toccato, se pensate che questo progetto sia degno di nota, se volete aiutarci, fate una donazione.

    Abbiamo calcolato che per portare a termine correttamente questo progetto, senza scorciatoie, sono necessari 24000 Euro. Io ed il mio team ci teniamo a questo progetto. Vogliamo vederlo volare, vogliamo vederlo aiutare delle persone, vogliamo dare anche noi il nostro piccolo contribuito a quella che è l'umanità quest'oggi. Anche se è un contributo molto piccolo. Ci piacerebbe vedere questo drone volare ed aiutare le persone a compiere tutte le misurazioni del caso in luoghi “pericolosi”. Quindi abbiamo deciso che inizieremo a lavorare al progetto anche nel caso in cui riuscissimo a raccogliere molti meno fondi: vogliamo investire il nostro tempo e le nostre risorse in questo progetto. Abbiamo deciso che se riusciremo a raccogliere 6500 euro inizieremo in ogni caso i lavori. Per questo abbiamo impostato 6500 euro come obbiettivo della campagna.

    Ogni aiuto, anche piccolo, è davvero importante. E ogni aiuto verrà riconosciuto.

    Voglio ripetermi: c'è bisogno di voi per far diventare realtà questo progetto.

Project EMS00X – Environmental Measuring Station

  • プロジェクトには、数行で説明
    このプロジェクトは、固定環境モニタリングステーションの開発と一つの移動に焦点を当てています。局は、このような領域における放射能、または大気汚染などの値を測定する。移動局は、事実上自律無人機（    UAV）となります。一度完成したプロジェクトは、公的に我々は十分な予算を得ることができるかどうかもまた、周囲を測定する両方のステーションを購入することができ、電子商取引を開き、同じ（オープンソース）を実現するための充電方式の自由を完全に解放されます。

  • なぜオープンソース？
    オープンソース技術のこのタイプは自由でなければならないので、。我々の誰もが、このプロジェクトで使用されてきた時間と資源の恩恵を受けることができるはずです。 大学、研究機関、民間企業や愛好家は、このプロジェクトをコピーするために図やコードにアクセスできるようになります。彼らは、ダイアグラム以下と低コストと内容の彼らのプロジェクトを複製することができます。この時代は、我々は知識や技術を共有し、共同作業をする必要があります。団結して私たち自身を助けるために。すべてを共有する。このため、本プロジェクトは、オープンソースでなければなりません。あなたは、オープンソースハードウェアが何であるかわからない？あなたは、ソースハードウェアをオープンに関連する取り組みについて知らされていない？そして、このビデオを見て！それは、インスピレーションのわれわれの情報源の一つです。http://youtu.be/jklVbLQjWXs ( Marcin Jakubowski: オープンソースプロジェクトのための機械)

  • プロジェクトの最終的な目標は何ですか？
    これは、特定の環境の研究に興味がある人々を助けたいプロジェクトであり、これは個人的に彼を取り巻く環境にも適用される。 <<目的は、人間が公開しなくても、 「リスクがある」とみなさ場所での安全性を研究することを支援することです：このプロジェクトの重要な部分の一つは、 UAV無人機であるという事実を考えると、それはこのような文を配合することが可能である最前線。テクノロジーは私たちの生活をより快適にするために存在していないだけでなく、人間そのものへの損傷を防ぐために、私たちはまた、完全な安全性に​​私たちの周りの環境を研究を支援する。 >>

    プロジェクトが完了すると、測定のドローン、両方の基地局の両方の構築のために必要なすべてのダイアグラムを提供するサイトを開きます。ハードウェアの回路図、およびコード、必要なソフトウェア側の両方が提供されます。
    また、我々は調達した場合、十分な資金が両方のステーションが以前に組み立てられ、動作して表示されます（ただし、日曜大工に助言していきますオンラインストアをオープンします。モバイルまたは固定かどうか、それがよりよく理解するのに役立ちます。ここで、 「から測定ステーションを建設動作は、建設の過程）のカスタマイズおよび修正、任意のタイプに適用することが可能となる。     

  • 現実どのようにこのプロジェクトを支援することになる？

    このプロジェクトは、あなただけのそれぞれの助けを借りて現実になることができます。、私が書いたことを触れている場合は、このプロジェクトは注目に値すると思われる場合あなたが私たちを助けてくださるのであれば、、、Indiegogo via寄付をしてください。寄付のためのアドレスは以下のhttp://www.igg.me/at/projectemsです。 我々はショートカットせずに、適切に、このプロジェクトを完了するように:計画するので、あなたは24000ユーロを必要とします。私と私のチームは、このプロジェクトが終わり働くことを希望する。私達はそれが飛ぶのをみたい。今日の人類が小さな貢献をして、人々を助けるのを見たい。小さな寄付であったとしても，我々は、この無人機が飛ぶと場所でケースのすべての測定をするために人々を助ける見てみたい"危ない。 だから我々は、このプロジェクトに私たちが投資したい時間と経営資源よりはるかに少ないお金しか集まらないとしても、我々はプロジェクトの作業を開始することとした。我々は6500 ユーロを収集するどのような状態でも、作業を開始することを決めたこのために我々は、ユーロキャンペーンのターゲットとして6500を設定しました。すべての助けは、どんなに小さくても、本当に重要です。そしてすべての助けは報われる。 私は自分自身に繰り返して言いたい：私たちは、あなたがこのプロジェクトが現実のものとなるようにする必要があります。

	<<目的は、人間が公開しなくても、
	「リスクがある」とみなさ場所での安全性を研究することを支援することです：このプロジェクトの重要な部分の一つは、
	UAV無人機であるという事実を考えると、それはこのような文を配合することが可能である最前線。テクノロジーは私たちの生活をより快適にするために存在していないだけでなく、人間そのものへの損傷を防ぐために、私たちはまた、完全な安全性に​​私たちの周りの環境を研究を支援する。
	>>プロジェクトが完了すると、測定のドローン、両方の基地局の両方の構築のために必要なすべてのダイアグラムを提供するサイトを開きます。ハードウェアの回路図、およびコード、必要なソフトウェア側の両方が提供されます。また、我々は調達した場合、十分な資金が両方のステーションが以前に組み立てられ、動作して表示されます（ただし、日曜大工に助言していきますオンラインストアをオープンします。モバイルまたは固定かどうか、それがよりよく理解するのに役立ちます。ここで、
	「から測定ステーションを建設動作は、建設の過程）のカスタマイズおよび修正、任意のタイプに適用することが可能となる。 
現実どのようにこのプロジェクトを支援することになる？

このプロジェクトは、あなただけのそれぞれの助けを借りて現実になることができます。、私が書いたことを触れている場合は、このプロジェクトは注目に値すると思われる場合あなたが私たちを助けてくださるのであれば、、、Indiegogo
via寄付をしてください。寄付のためのアドレスは以下のhttp://www.igg.me/at/projectemsです。
我々はショートカットせずに、適切に、このプロジェクトを完了するように:計画するので、あなたは24000ユーロを必要とします。私と私のチームは、このプロジェクトが終わり働くことを希望する。私達はそれが飛ぶのをみたい。今日の人類が小さな貢献をして、人々を助けるのを見たい。小さな寄付であったとしても，我々は、この無人機が飛ぶと場所でケースのすべての測定をするために人々を助ける見てみたい"危ない。
だから我々は、このプロジェクトに私たちが投資したい時間と経営資源よりはるかに少ないお金しか集まらないとしても、我々はプロジェクトの作業を開始することとした。我々は6500
ユーロを収集するどのような状態でも、作業を開始することを決めたこのために我々は、ユーロキャンペーンのターゲットとして6500を設定しました。すべての助けは、どんなに小さくても、本当に重要です。そしてすべての助けは報われる。
私は自分自身に繰り返して言いたい：私たちは、あなたがこのプロジェクトが現実のものとなるようにする必要があります。

story:
Thank you to all who donated to this worthwhile cause!

With a total of 27 funders we raised a brilliant €1280. This money will help us buy 1600 meters of nets that cover the needs of 12 fishermen of Lipsi. We did not reach our goal but it is a good start. We will keep on trying raising more funds so that we are able to support more fishermen, as well as, introducing this action in more Greek marine regions. By providing the fishermen these nets of a larger mesh, we will diminish conflict between them and the marine mammals, and will also help improve and regenerate fish stocks. After providing the nets, the Archipelagos team will work closely with the fishermen in order to improve the sustainable fishing of the area. Stay tuned for more updates on this project and on other projects that we develop at the time being.

Once again thank you so much for your kind donation!


Θα θέλαμε να ευχαριστήσουμε θερμά όλους εσάς που συνεισφέρατε σε αυτόν τον αξιόλογο σκοπό.

Δεχτήκαμε από συνολικά 27 δωρητές το ποσό των €1280. Μπορεί να μην φτάσαμε τον στόχο που είχαμε αρχικά θέσει, αλλά σίγουρα είναι μια καλή αρχή. Με το ποσό αυτό θα μπορέσουμε να αγοράσουμε 1600 μέτρα διχτυών τα οποία καλύπτουν τις ανάγκες 12 ψαράδων των Λειψών. Παράλληλα, συνεχίζουμε την προσπάθεια ανεύρεσης επιπλέον πόρων που θα μας επιτρέψουν να στηρίξουμε περισσότερους ψαράδες στους Λειψούς, αλλά και να επεκτείνουμε αυτή την προσπάθεια και σε άλλες περιοχές των ελληνικών θαλασσών. Με αυτά τα νέα επιλεκτικά δίχτυα στοχεύουμε να μειώσουμε τον ανταγωνισμό μεταξύ αλιέων και θαλάσσιων θηλαστικών και συνάμα θα βοηθήσουμε στην ανάκαμψη των ιχθυαποθεμάτων της περιοχής. Μετά την αγορά των διχτυών, η ομάδα του Αρχιπελάγους σκοπεύει να εργαστεί, όπως έκανε μέχρι και σήμερα, στο πλευρό των αλιέων, έτσι ώστε να συμβάλλει στην βελτίωση των αλιευτικών πρακτικών για μία βιώσιμη αλιεία. Μείνετε συντονισμένοι για περαιτέρω ενημερώσεις σχετικά με τις δράσεις μας.

Σας ευχαριστούμε και πάλι για την ευγενική δωρεά σας!


Save the dolphins and seals and help the fishing community on the small island of Lipsi in the Aegean Sea


According to legend, many years ago the island of Lipsi was where Ulysses met Kalypso to spend a long and infinite life. From this story the name Lipsi derives from Kalypso.

Lipsi is found in the eastern Aegean Sea in Greece and is home to a wonderful marine biodiversity, which includes many endangered marine mammals. The island has a small population, comprising only 790 inhabitants. Small scale fisheries have long been the basis of this community, providing food and jobs. Many of the islanders are small scale fishermen and with their small boats spend all night, every night working hard at sea.


> WHAT IS THE ISSUE?

The dramatic decline in fish stocks over the past decade has caused increasing pressure on both fishermen and marine mammals. Both have the same problem in finding fish and this causes an increase in conflict between small-scale fishermen and marine mammals such as the bottlenose dolphin (Tursiops truncatus), the critically endangered Mediterranean monk seal (Monachus monachus) and loggerhead turtles (Caretta caretta).

As a result these rare marine animals increasingly take food directly from the nets of small-scale fishermen. Not only does this cause costly damage to the fishermen’s nets, but their catches are also being “stolen” and thus their earnings are reduced. Furthermore, on rare occasions, dolphins and monk seals sometimes can become entangled in the nets and die. This can be detrimental to populations, especially for the already critically endangered Mediterranean monk seal.


> WHAT DOES ARCHIPELAGOS DO?

Archipelagos Institute of Marine Conservation (www.archipelago.gr) is working to create a co-managed fisheries protected area around the island by working closely with the local community to give them active role in the protection of their fish stocks.

For this reason an international team of volunteer scientists and students from Archipelagos have been based on the island of Lipsi for the past 5 months and continue to work there in order to collect the necessary data for the creation of this fisheries protected area.

As a short-term solution to reduce the conflict between fishermen and marine mammals, Archipelagos’ scientists are seeking funds that will allow them to replace the fishermen's small-mesh nets with nets composed of a larger mesh. Marine mammals tend to cause less damage to these, while this type of net is also more selective (i.e. has bigger holes and catches larger fish) and hence contributes to a more sustainable fishery. This helps to reduce conflict between the two groups.


> WHAT IS THIS CAMPAIGN FOR?

Archipelagos would like to help in reducing the conflict between the small scale fishermen and marine mammals by purchasing and providing the local fishermen with nets of larger mesh. These have two benefits:

  • First of all, they are less damaged by marine mammals

  • Secondly, because the larger holes in the nets are more selective, the fishing practice is more sustainable because smaller fish can escape and repopulate the area


> Help us protect marine mammals

> Help us reduce the conflict between artisanal fishermen and marine mammals, and actively involve fishermen in their conservation.

> Help us ensure sustainable practices of fishing, with minimum damage to the environment.

> Help us protect and increase fish stocks

> Help us collaborate with more fishermen across more Aegean Islands.



IN ORDER TO REACH OUT TO ALL THE SMALL SCALE FISHERMEN OF THE LIPSI COMMUNITY WE HOPE TO ACHIEVE €5400.



> WHO WE ARE ?

Archipelagos Institute of Marine Conservation is an environmental non-profit organization, committed to protect and defend the marine and island biodiversity of the North Eastern Mediterranean. Our main actions are to:

  • Carry out scientific work about biodiversity conservation
  • Work in close collaboration with the local communities
  • Report actions to national and EU authorities
  • Develop realistic and sustainable management measures, in cooperation with the island communities

Visit us on our website or our facebook page

story:
Do you deserve to have an informed choice of what you feed your family?

In the USA, GMOs are not labeled…think it’s not an issue for you? Think again…

  • GMOs are BANNED or significantly restricted in over 40 countries around the world including China, Russia and all of the European Union

  • GMOs are now present in nearly 80% of conventional processed food in the US (according to the Grocery Manufacturers Association)

  • There are over 75 genetically engineered foods in the pipeline that companies are trying to get approved including an apple that NEVER turns brown!

  • Average meal contains ingredients from 5 countries

  • An apple takes on average 14 months from harvesting to the time it reaches your table


Refer Your Friends and Get Rewards!


Did you Know?

  • Average meal contains ingredients from 5 countries with less than 10% of that food inspected

  • Average apple takes 14 months from time of harvest to reach your table – stored in a warehouse for up to 1 year

  • Over 1/3 of produce in America is imported


Our Solution:

  • Nutrient Dense, Fresh Organic, Non-GMO Produce.

    • Harvested and shipped with the roots on within 24-hours of harvesting*!

      (*to most West Coast states)

  • Affordable Prices.

    • Up to 50% less than many organic produce in store prices!

  • Preserve Water
    • Our method uses 98% less water than typical farming
  • Maximize our land.
    • Living Produce uses 88% less land mass than typical farming
  • Preserve the roots of the produce AND the community of like-minded people joining forces.
    • 40 acres can feed over 200,000 people
    • Generating over 120 million pounds of nutrient dense produce


Preserve Land. Preserve Water.

With Living Produce, we use 88% less land mass for production and less than 95% of the water.

Why We Need Living Produce

Are GMOs Safe?

It doesn’t matter, you won’t be suing their creators thanks to the passing of the “Monsanto Act” which frees biotech companies from their liability to the people and from judicial accountability.

Many believe there’s something that seems sneaky about people manufacturing, engineering and processing food and then when it’s done…they don’t want to tell anyone what’s actually in it. Why? What are they hiding? What don’t they want us to know?

Look at clothing, manufacturers are required to list the contents of what we wear. It’s important for us to know what we are wearing, but not what we are eating?

  • GMOs are now present in 75 to 80% of conventional processed food in the U.S. (according to the Grocery Manufacturers Association.)

  • In the U.S 90% of all soybeans are genetically engineered

Because vertical growing can take place in “closed system” greenhouse facilities, we can maintain a sterile growing and handling environment. Unlike with organically grown crops in outdoor environments, we can eliminate plant contamination from animal feces and urine, transfer of potential feces from human picking and handling, airborne pathogens and downwind spay of toxic chemicals, fertilizers and pesticides. This makes Living Produce a safe alternative to produce grown in uncontrolled environments.

How Fresh Is Your Produce?

Avoid Contamination & Enhanced Food Safety

Virtually Eliminate Waste

  • 33% of all food produced each year is wasted

  • Over $15 billion/year is lost by super markets in unsold produce

  • $250 billion is lost due to waste throughout the entire food chain

  • Nearly $3,000 per year is wasted on over 240 pounds of food that is thrown out by the average family

We are delivered fresh to your door within 24-hours of harvesting. It’s almost like having produce “On Demand!” Our goal is to significantly reduce the food wasted in our supply chain while feeding more people.

Distribution - We can deliver to many west coast states within 24-hours of harvesting! That’s what we call Fresh to Your Door, On the Dot! It doesn’t get much easier than opening your door to pick up fresh produce.

Year-Round Production – Since Living Produce is grown in “closed” indoor, climate-controlled growing centers, this enables year-round production of favorite varieties and rare plant varietals that are often difficult to get.

Superior Plant Nutrients – The patent-pending growing technology delivers the full spectrum of nutrients required for healthy, sustainable plant growth.

Sample Photos of patent Pending Technology



When

With your help…once we reach our goal we can be in production within 90-days! You can be one of the first on the list to receive notification and the first shipment of Living Produce!


Why Now

If not now, when? We have to take charge and start making a difference by preserving our land, preserving our water and restoring the roots of what make us great as a society! With your help, we know we are the community that is going to lead the way for how produce is grown in the future. We have the opportunity now to feed hundreds of millions, not with chemical laden food, rather with nutrient dense AFFORDABLE produce! But we can’t do it alone, we need your help.

Where

Our land is just outside Salt Lake City, UT. We have purchased 40-acres which allows us to be able to deliver to most of the western states within 24-hours of harvesting produce.


What - Living Produce

literally alive when it arrives at your door!

Living Produce is literally alive when delivered to your door, the next day after being harvested. Then, your produce can remain alive for 7 to 10 days before it loses peak phytonutrient value.

Progress

We have already purchased the land, have the architectural drawings and commitments for the majority of the funding. So why are we asking for your help?

We want a community behind our build. We want to know that we have people that support our efforts from the roots up and are dedicated to this type of lifestyle and creating a new eco-system in our agricultural community.

Use of Funds

We will use 100% of the funds we raise from this campaign to actually build the first growhouse! You will be part of making this happen and to reward you, you will be one of the first we notify when we are ready to ship our first orders of Living Produce!

Who Are We?


  • Founded in 2011

  • Premier customer direct “clean” food supply

    • Non-GMO

    • No pesticides

    • No toxic herbicides

    • No pathogens

Our Management

Rod Smith, Founder and CEO, has extensive experience in start-up development, successfully taking a private company he founded, public. (InContact, NASDAQ symbol: SAAS) Mr. Smith plans to add qualified management to GPDB’s management team at this stage of the company’s development; including a Chief Financial Officer, Chief Operating Officer, V.P. of Sales and Marketing, etc.—as revenues build and circumstances dictate.


William (Bill) Roberts, Director is the Chief Operating Officer and President of GEICO Insurance, Mr. Roberts has also served in behalf of GEICO’s four insurance companies with responsibility for marketing, underwriting and pricing for each of these companies since 1997. Roberts joined GEICO in 1984 and has served as assistant VP of Marketing, then V.P. of Marketing. Roberts earned a Ph.D. in sociology from Temple University in Philadelphia, Pa. He brings expertise and wisdom, grounded in experience, along with a high level of enthusiasm; all of which make him very qualified to help grow Green PolkaDot Box to reach its potential.


Andrew Smith, Director received his B.S. Degree in Accounting at the University to Utah in 1978, and his CPA certificate in 1979. He worked in public accounting as an auditor and business consultant for 11 years. He has been a controller, business manager and financial officer for 23 years in several startup and early stage growth companies. He has over 30 years of valuable experience in leadership and management of financial accounting functions, corporate finance and human resources. His work experience includes manufacturing, construction, property management, distribution and personal services industries. Andrew is not related to Green PolkaDot Box CEO, Rod Smith.


Management for Living Produce
Growing Center Operations

Horst Schindler, Director of Processing Operations, holds double masters’ degrees in Mechanical Engineering and Factory Management at Technical University Darmstadt. He is a veteran designer, engineer of produce processing facilities and equipment around the Globe. With over 40 years’ experience in multiple applications of buildings and equipment systems for processing all varieties of commercially grown, high density produce operations, Mr. Schindler is eminently qualified to oversee the development and operations of the Spring City LPGC.


Aad Jensen, Director of Growing Operations, has a been actively growing high density produce for over 20 years, working with the leading growing operations in the United States, Canada, Mexico and Scandinavia such as Pelemex and Masterati. He is a world-class expert in greenhouse configuration and climate control, seed selection, growing climatology, high density growing technologies and fertilizer systems.


Rough Bros. Construction is a master builder of leading greenhouse systems. A construction documents are available upon request.

Land is Already Prepared for our Building Site)

Perks

Bronze Perk

Refrigerator Sticker/Car Bumper Magnet – Show the world that you support an organic Non-GMO world, healthy lifestyle and desire for a greener environment.

VALUE - $35

$25

Silver Perk

T Shirt and Sample Box –

Proudly wear our t-shirt and tell the world you Love a Green Life and Healthy Lifestyle!
Our sample box is filled with one surprise after another. We pull a variety of great Non-GMO, all organic products, pack them up and ship them to you.

VALUE - $75

$50

Gold Perk

Appethyl OR Gift Sample Box -

2-month’s Supply of Appethyl is being touted as one of the best all natural appetite suppressants on the market. Pure spinach is the primary ingredient so it is nutritious and effective.

Gift Sample Box – double the quantity, double the fun! This gift box is filled with twice the samples and goodies that we offer in our normal sample box. Remember, all of the products we distribute are always Non-GMO and organic!
VALUE - $150

$100

Platinum Perk

Appethyl AND Gift Sample Box

Why choose? Simply enjoy a 3-month supply of Appethyl AND the ultimate Gift Sample Box from Green PolkaDot Box. The box is filled with one great product after another for you to enjoy. So contribute today and start indulging!

VALUE - $325

$250

Diamond Perk

12 Month supply of Living Produce (Ships twice a month) PLUS gift bundle (t-shirt, sticker, Gift Sample Box)

Ready to start reaping the tasty benefits of your contribution? We will gladly ship you a month’s supply of the standard family package of fresh produce. Delivered to your door with the roots still on for ultimate freshness! Let us continue to reward you at this level with the t-shirt, sticker AND ultimate Gift Sampler Box! Cash in the value now!

VALUE – Over $1,300

$1,000

Double Diamond Perk

12 Month supply of Living Produce (shipped weekly) PLUS gift bundle

Want more Freshness? We will ship your Living Produce weekly to your door and will include a monthly Gift Sampler Box! You will enjoy the ultimate fresh produce weekly and be surprised with new, healthy, non-GMO food products monthly in our robust gift box!

VALUE – over $5,300

$5,000

Triple Diamond Perk

Name on Green House
Printed inside shipped boxed 'courtesy of'
Gift Bundle
Supply of Living Produce

This is the ultimate contribution level so let us reward you accordingly. Put your name permanently on one of our Green Houses and NAME IT! It can be your family name or another name that has meaning to you. Let your pride for being committed and devoted to making our planet a better, greener and healthier place be known! And…of course we will give you all the bonuses of the previous level as well as shipping a Sample Gift Box to someone courtesy of YOU. Take advantage as there are only 5 available at this level.

VALUE – You decide! In our mind, this is priceless to have your name left in legacy on a first ever Living Produce Greenhouse building!

$10,000

Refer Your Friends and Get Rewards!

 Many believe  there’s something that seems sneaky about people manufacturing,  engineering and processing food and then when it’s done…they  don’t want to tell anyone what’s actually in it. Why? What are  they hiding? What don’t they want us to know?
 Look  at clothing, manufacturers are required to list the contents of what  we wear. It’s important for us to know what we are wearing, but not  what we are eating? 


 GMOs are  	now present in 75 to 80% of conventional processed food in the U.S.  	(according to the Grocery Manufacturers Association.)


 In the U.S  	90% of all soybeans are genetically engineered


 

Because vertical growing can take place  in “closed system” greenhouse facilities, we can maintain a  sterile growing and handling environment.  Unlike with organically  grown crops in outdoor environments, we can eliminate plant  contamination from animal feces and urine, transfer of potential  feces from human picking and handling, airborne pathogens and  downwind spay of toxic chemicals, fertilizers and pesticides.  This  makes Living Produce a safe alternative to produce grown in  uncontrolled environments.


 
How Fresh Is Your Produce?
 
 
Avoid Contamination & Enhanced Food Safety
 


Virtually Eliminate Waste
 




33% of all food produced each year  	is wasted


Over $15 billion/year is lost by  	super markets in unsold produce


$250 billion is lost due to waste  	throughout the entire food chain


Nearly $3,000 per year is wasted  	on over 240 pounds of food that is thrown out by the average family


We are delivered  fresh to your door within 24-hours of harvesting.  It’s almost like  having produce “On Demand!”  Our goal is to significantly reduce  the food wasted in our supply chain while feeding more people.  


Distribution - We can deliver to  many west coast states within 24-hours of harvesting!  That’s what  we call Fresh to Your Door, On the Dot!  It doesn’t get much easier  than opening your door to pick up fresh produce.
Year-Round Production – Since  Living Produce is grown in “closed” indoor, climate-controlled  growing centers, this enables year-round production of favorite  varieties and rare plant varietals that are often difficult to get. 
Superior Plant Nutrients – The patent-pending growing technology delivers the  full spectrum of nutrients required for healthy, sustainable plant  growth. 
 
 
Sample Photos of patent Pending Technology




When
With your help…once  we reach our goal we can be in production within 90-days!  You can be  one of the first on the list to receive notification and the first  shipment of Living Produce!



Why Now
If  not now, when? We have to take charge and start making a difference  by preserving our land, preserving our water and restoring the roots  of what make us great as a society!  With your help, we know we are  the community that is going to lead the way for how produce is grown  in the future.  We have the opportunity now to feed hundreds of  millions, not with chemical laden food, rather with nutrient dense  AFFORDABLE produce!  But we can’t do it alone, we need your help.
 
Where
Our land is just  outside Salt Lake City, UT.  We have purchased 40-acres which allows  us to be able to deliver to most of the western states within  24-hours of harvesting produce. 


 What - Living Produce
  literally alive when it arrives at your door!
Living Produce is  literally alive when delivered to your door, the next day after being  harvested.  Then, your produce can remain alive for 7 to 10 days  before it loses peak phytonutrient value.

 
Progress
We  have already purchased the land, have the architectural drawings and  commitments for the majority of the funding.  So why are we asking  for your help? 
We want a community  behind our build.  We want to know that we have people that support  our efforts from the roots up and are dedicated to this type of  lifestyle and creating a new eco-system in our agricultural  community. 


 

Use of Funds
We will use 100% of the funds we raise from this campaign to  actually build the first growhouse!  You will be part of making this  happen and to reward you, you will be one of the first we notify when  we are ready to ship our first orders of Living Produce! 
 

Who Are  We? 





Founded in 2011


Premier customer direct “clean”  	food supply


Non-GMO


No pesticides


No toxic herbicides


No pathogens




 
Our  Management
 Rod  Smith, Founder and CEO,  has extensive experience in start-up development, successfully taking  a private company he founded, public. (InContact, NASDAQ symbol:  SAAS) Mr. Smith plans to add qualified management to GPDB’s  management team at this stage of the company’s development;  including a Chief Financial Officer, Chief Operating Officer, V.P. of  Sales and Marketing, etc.—as revenues build and circumstances  dictate. 
 

 William  (Bill) Roberts, Director is  the Chief Operating Officer and President of GEICO Insurance, Mr.  Roberts has also served in behalf of GEICO’s four insurance  companies with responsibility for marketing, underwriting and pricing  for each of these companies since 1997. Roberts joined GEICO in 1984  and has served as assistant VP of Marketing, then V.P. of Marketing.  Roberts earned a Ph.D. in sociology from Temple University in  Philadelphia, Pa. He brings expertise and wisdom, grounded in  experience, along with a high level of enthusiasm; all of which make  him very qualified to help grow Green PolkaDot Box to reach its  potential.
 

 Andrew  Smith, Director received his B.S. Degree in Accounting at the University to Utah in  1978, and his CPA certificate in 1979. He worked in public accounting  as an auditor and business consultant for 11 years. He has been a  controller, business manager and financial officer for 23 years in  several startup and early stage growth companies. He has over 30  years of valuable experience in leadership and management of  financial accounting functions, corporate finance and human  resources. His work experience includes manufacturing, construction,  property management, distribution and personal services industries.  Andrew is not related to Green PolkaDot Box CEO, Rod Smith.
 

 Management  for Living Produce 
  Growing Center Operations

 Horst  Schindler, Director  of Processing Operations,  holds double masters’ degrees in Mechanical Engineering and Factory  Management at Technical University Darmstadt. He is a veteran  designer, engineer of produce processing facilities and equipment  around the Globe. With over 40 years’ experience in multiple  applications of buildings and equipment systems for processing all  varieties of commercially grown, high density produce operations, Mr.  Schindler is eminently qualified to oversee the development and  operations of the Spring City LPGC.
 

 Aad  Jensen, Director  of Growing Operations,  has a been actively growing high density produce for over 20 years,  working with the leading growing operations in the United States,  Canada, Mexico and Scandinavia such as Pelemex and Masterati. He is a  world-class expert in greenhouse configuration and climate control,  seed selection, growing climatology, high density growing  technologies and fertilizer systems.


 Rough  Bros. Construction is a master builder of leading greenhouse systems. A construction  documents are available upon request.



Land  is Already Prepared for our Building Site)
 

 
 
 
PerksBronze Perk
Refrigerator
Sticker/Car Bumper Magnet – Show the world that you support an
organic Non-GMO world, healthy lifestyle and desire for a greener
environment. 

VALUE
- $35

$25

Sample
Box – Proudly wear our t-shirt and tell the world you Love a
Green Life and Healthy Lifestyle!  Our sample box is filled with
one surprise after another.  We pull a variety of great Non-GMO, all
organic products, pack them up and ship them to you.  

VALUE

Gold PerkAppethyl

touted as one of the best all natural appetite suppressants on the
market. Pure spinach is the primary ingredient so it is nutritious
and effective. 

Gift
Sample Box – double the quantity, double the fun!  This gift box is
filled with twice the samples and goodies that we offer in our normal
sample box.  Remember, all of the products we distribute are always
Non-GMO and organic! 	VALUE - $150

$100

Why
choose?  Simply enjoy a 3-month supply of Appethyl AND the ultimate
Gift Sample Box from Green PolkaDot Box.  The box is filled with one
great product after another for you to enjoy.  So contribute today
and start indulging!
VALUE

Month supply of Living Produce  (Ships twice a month)  PLUS gift
bundle (t-shirt, sticker, Gift Sample Box)
Ready
to start reaping the tasty benefits of your contribution?  We will
gladly ship you a month’s supply of the standard family package of
fresh produce.  Delivered to your door with the roots still on for
ultimate freshness!  Let us continue to reward you at this level with
the t-shirt, sticker AND ultimate Gift Sampler Box!  Cash in the
value now!
VALUE
– Over $1,300

$1,000

 
 
 
 
 
Double Diamond Perk

Month supply of Living Produce (shipped weekly) PLUS gift bundle
Want
more Freshness?  We will ship your Living Produce weekly to your door
and will include a monthly Gift Sampler Box!  You will enjoy the
ultimate fresh produce weekly and be surprised with new, healthy,
non-GMO food products monthly in our robust gift box!
VALUE

This
is the ultimate contribution level so let us reward you accordingly. 
Put your name permanently on one of our Green Houses and NAME IT!  It
can be your family name or another name that has meaning to you.  Let
your pride for being committed and devoted to making our planet a
better, greener and healthier place be known!  And…of course we
will give you all the bonuses of the previous level as well as
shipping a Sample Gift Box to someone courtesy of YOU.  Take
advantage as there are only 5 available at this level.

story:
'Connect with Earth' is a Route of Responsible Tourism between South America and South Pacific to promote projects of conservation in/around protected areas. Already we are created strategic alliances with organisations from Venezuela and Peru. Currently, I am looking for alliances with organisations from New Zealand and Australia.

In a term of 2 years we expect to consolidate intercultural exchange programmes between both areas (South America and South Pacific) based on volunteering and specialized tourism groups.

The raised funds will be invested to improve faster our content and image while we keep researching information about destinations of interest.



WE ARE

Conciencia y Confluencia - Consciousness and Confluence (cyC) is a proposal of communication. It was born on April 2009, having as its main aim to consolidate a communication code to broadcast informative, educational and promotional content focused on the development of individual responsible attitudes and behaviours with our communities and protected areas.

OUR INTENTION

Since last September we have been focused on designing a Route of Responsible Tourism between South America and South Pacific. Our aim is to create an international network of destinations and tourism services, which are deeply committed to social and environmental development through responsible practices. In a term of two (2) years we expect to consolidate intercultural exchange programmes between both areas based on volunteering and specialized tourism groups.

OUR SCOPE

We deeply believe that it is possible to bring travel services to these tourists. For this reason, and taking into account the audience that is already following this proposal, to select destinations for this route we are focused on three (3) categories: Passages, Conservation and Yoga.

1.  Passages: Destinations in/around protected areas (preferable, but not restrictive) where tourist can practice hiking, rock climbing and kayaking.

2.  Conservation: Organisations of conservation located in/around protected areas, which bring tourism services.

3.  Yoga: Centres and initiatives where people can wide their knowledge and experience of this practices while they are traveling.

As complement to these destinations, we are contacting different kinds of service’s providers (accommodation, meals, etc.) to broadcast information of initiatives of Responsible Consuming.

BE WITH US

Currently, I am looking to create a network with organisations and companies from New Zealand and Australia, and I would love for you to be with us. If you are interested, you can become a friend or a member of this proposal. We already have visited Venezuela, Chile and Peru and we created strategic alliances with some organizations from Venezuela and Peru.

I am already in New Zealand and on next year I will return to Australia. I already have contacted different projects in both countries that I will visit them on next year to discuss about further alliances.

The requested funds are needed to cover accommodation and transport expenses during next 2 months while I am visiting the destinations mentioned below in New Zealand. Also to bring an incentive to some collaborators and consequently to be able to increase our audiences while we are improving our image and content.

A 60% of the raised funds are needed to cover accommodation and transport expenses during next 2 months while we are visiting the destinations mentioned below, 30% will be invested as incentive to our translator, community manager and graphic designer, and 10% to develop promotional material.

Be a Friend: Support us from $ 5 and help us to reach more audience promoting our social medias. Receive a digital postcard for your collaboration. 

Be a Member: Support us from $ 50 and you will receive a digital postcard with you membership number and our newsletter to keep informed about our next steps, new alliances, workshops and other activities promoted by cyC during 2015. Also you will be able to receive discounts in our activities based on further negotiations with our allies and sponsors. Or support us from $ 200 and you could receive one of our exclusive handmade IPad bags sponsored by aiSlarte.

You always can contribute sharing/commenting our content from website and social medias, promoting this proposal, helping us to find sponsors.


NEXT DESTINATIONS


Based on its cultural, scenic and biologic diversity New Zealand and Australia are highlighted destinations for the project of Conciencia y Confluencia. So during next months until July 2015 I will be working to create alliances in those countries, for this reason I need your support.

VISIT OUR MEDIAS

At the moment we are translating our website content to English, so we already have limited content in this language, however you are still invited to visit: www.concienciayconfluencia.com/ Facebook: Conciencia y Confluencia

Twitter: @cyConfluencia / Instagram: cyConfluencia


cyC has brought support to different environmental and social projects since 2009. We are deeply committed with our work and would love your support. You can also support us following our social medias and promoting our work. 

Thanks for your time and attention

Best regards

Liliana Medina Toro =)

story:
Short Summary

The Terra Viva Grants Directory develops and manages free information about grants for agriculture, energy, environment, and natural resources in the world's developing countries.  The Directory includes free postings from over 500 grant makers, with regional coverage for the developing world. Application deadlines are listed by months, subject areas, and forms of grant support.  The service also provides a strategic inclusion of information resources for grant seekers.


Project Background

To-date, TVGD has included a wealth of information on hundreds of sources of grants that we make available on a free website. Through a feed service, the Directory keeps free subscribers informed about new and recurring grants. However, a much needed improvement to the service would be an upgrade of its searchable database to expand and facilitate the use of the website. Since our service is free, TVGD has no revenue source to fund this valuable enhancement to the Directory.


Aim of the Project

The TVGD database development project aims to expand and improve its free services on the website by enhancing the existing searchable database of grant makers.

Your contributions will help pay for the technical programming and data management required to expand the database on the TVGD website. Once the database is upgraded, we expect a substantial increase in users of the Directory as they will be able to more easily and more efficiently sort the free information that they need to find grants for their developing world projects.

TVGD is a non-profit 501c3 institution which provides a free grant searching service for organizations that need funding support.


What We Need & What You Get

The additional programming of the searchable database will require approximately 10 working days by a technical and programming consultant. This individual will also run beta testing of the new database, as well as completing the final installation and initialization of the database.

The estimated total cost of the project is US$5,000.


The Impact

Currently, TVGD reaches 20 thousand organizations and individuals per month, 80% of whom are located in the developing countries.  The expansion of our searchable database will increase the number of users who are successful in finding the support that they need to make their projects successful in some of the poorest regions of the world. Your contribution to the upgrade of our services will allow TVGD to remain a free portal of information for groups who are least likely to afford payment for this type of service.

Why TVGD?

The TVGD Directory is one of the few if not the only free on-line sources of grants that focus on developing world initiatives in the areas of environment, energy, agriculture and natural resources. Your donations to this effort will:

  • Allow TVGD resources to remain free for the many small and medium sized efforts that cannot afford to pay high application and proposal fees when searching for funding.
  • Although it is a free service, maintain leading technologies and high quality service while expanding access for the users of our site.
  • Improve access for under-served developing world populations.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the following link with anyone searching for project funding for the environment, energy, natural resources or agriculture in the world’s developing countries - http://www.terravivagrants.org/ 

Also, you could share our Indiegogo link to others that you know who might donate to the TVGD searchable database upgrade.

story:
1.Description générale du projet.
2.Précision sur le projet
3.Résultats


Le projet Elasticoli

Bonjour à tous et bienvenue sur la page du projet Elasticoli. Derrière ce nom un peu étrange se cache en réalité un projet scientifique ambitieux mené par un groupe d’étudiants bordelais. 



Bien sûr, ne vous en faites pas, nous allons tout faire pour rendre ce projet le plus compréhensible possible auprès de tous ! Ce projet est tout ce qu’il y a de plus sérieux et s’inscrit dans le cadre d’une compétition étudiante internationale : l’iGEM (international Genetically Engineered Machines).

Cette compétition, comme son nom l’indique est une compétition de biologie de synthèse (on reviendra sur ce principe plus tard) organisée par le prestigieux MIT (Massachussetts Institute of Technology, Boston) qui rassemble cette année plusieurs centaines d’équipes à travers le monde.



Comme chaque équipe participante, nous allons utiliser les outils de la biologie de synthèse pour imaginer et créer de nouveaux systèmes biologiques avec des propriétés étonnantes. La biologie de synthèse, c’est un des domaines qui connait le plus de croissance dans le secteur de la biologie et des biotechnologies. Cette discipline regroupe l’ensemble des techniques utilisées par les généticiens, les biologistes moléculaires et autres scientifiques qui permettent de concevoir des organismes vivants avec des caractéristiques inédites.

Oui bon euh ... ça serait drôle en effet, mais ce n'est rien de tout ça. Ce que nous allons utiliser pour créer notre système biologique est un être vivant bien plus petit , même invisible à l’œil nu et pourtant présent dans chacun de nous.

C’est Escherichia coli, une bactérie bien connue des scientifiques.

Bien évidemment ! Vous ne le savez surement pas mais les bactéries sont utiles pour plein de choses. Ce sont même elles aujourd’hui qui produisent une partie des biocarburants ou certains de nos médicaments. Ce que nous allons leur faire fabriquer, ce sont des matériaux avec des propriétés plastiques, élastiques et entièrement biodégradables.

Oui en quelque sorte, mais avec des applications plus ciblées vers la santé et la médecine. Plus concrètement, nous allons faire produire à nos bactéries, un ensemble de protéines  comme celles que l’on retrouve dans les toiles d’araignées ou celles responsables de l’élasticité de notre peau qui vont ensuite s’assembler et former ce qu’on appelle des polymères.

C’est tout à fait ça, après quelques étapes d’électrospining ou autres procédés aux noms barbares on devrait obtenir des fils avec une élasticité et une résistance incroyable. Ces fils pourraient par exemple, dans le futur, être utilisés par les chirurgiens pour remplacer des tendons endommagés !



L'équipe iGEM Bordeaux



Ce projet c’est avant tout une expérience qui se vit en groupe. L’équipe IGEM Bordeaux 2014 c’est Diane, Claudia, Gilles, Edouard, Jean-Rémy, Mounir, Justine, Xavier, Julien, Zohra, Caroline, Floriane, Cassandra, Alexandre, Geoffrey, Hiba, Lauriane et Ismaël, tous étudiants en école d’ingénieur (ENSTBB) ou à l’Université de Bordeaux et encadrés par Denis Dupuy, Marie Beurton-Aimar et Elisabeth Garanger, chercheurs rattachés à l’INSERM ou au CNRS. Mais l’équipe IGEM Bordeaux 2014 c’est aussi toutes les personnes qui nous entourent au quotidien et qui nous aident à avancer dans ce projet ambitieux. Et puis, cette équipe c’est aussi un peu vous, passionnés de sciences ou simples curieux, qui comprenez l’intérêt de notre projet et l’intérêt de la biologie dans notre société actuelle. Au nom de toute l’équipe je vous adresse d’ores et déjà nos sincères remerciements pour les quelques minutes passées à découvrir notre projet.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Vous vous en doutez, la recherche de financements est une étape cruciale dans la réussite de notre projet. Nous sommes déjà soutenus par notre université et par quelques entreprises telles que Teknimed (spécialisée dans les biomatériaux), l'Ambassade de France aux Etats-Unis, la Région Aquitaine, Genscript, l'INSERM et le CNRS, mais nous avions envie, pour compléter notre budget, d’un financement collaboratif. Avec le "crowdfunding", nous souhaitons faire découvrir notre projet à un maximum de personnes. Cette plateforme nous permet, en plus de récolter des fonds, d’interagir directement avec vous, d’échanger nos idées et de vous faire part de nos avancées. Vous vous impliquez dans notre projet et on s’engage à une totale transparence, c’est là le principe séduisant du financement participatif.


L’argent que nous arriverons à récolter servira en premier à financer l’achat de matériel pour le laboratoire. 

Malheureusement non, entre les molécules chimiques qui rentrent dans la composition des milieux de culture ou les consommables utilisés pour les manipulations, les frais de laboratoire peuvent vite devenir importants. Mais nous avons déjà réussi à produire un peu de nos fameuses protéines ! Ensuite, une autre partie du financement servira à couvrir les frais d’inscription de l’équipe (2 600 €) et des participants (550 € par membre de l’équipe). C’est ce que représentent donc les 15 000 € dont nous avons besoin. Enfin, si vous vous montrez très généreux, l’argent restant sera utilisé pour envoyer un maximum de personnes de l’équipe présenter le projet. Et oui, souvenez-vous, la compétition est organisée par le MIT, et je vous laisse deviner où est localisé ce prestigieux institut ?

On est d’accord. C’est là-bas que toutes les équipes du monde participant au concours se retrouveront en octobre 2014 et qu’un jury spécialisé décernera les récompenses. Pour en savoir plus sur la compétition et sur cette année particulière qui marque le 10ème anniversaire de l’IGEM je vous invite à consulter le site internet officiel : http://2014.igem.org/Main_Page

En plus de nos sincères remerciements et de la satisfaction d’avoir accompli un acte généreux, l’équipe IGEM Bordeaux 2014 à envisagé différentes contreparties pour vous faire plaisir. Ainsi, vous vous verrez offrir, entre autres, des stickers, des cartes postales de Boston avec un mot de l’équipe, des t-shirts de l’équipe, des mugs ou encore des casquettes à nos couleurs, mais aussi des contreparties bien plus originales comme notre jeu de société IGAME inventé et développé par l’équipe qui vous assurera des moments sympas entre amis ou en famille tout en découvrant la biologie et la compétition iGEM. Pour les plus généreux d’entre vous, vous recevrez une photo unique de l’équipe portant une banderole à votre nom devant les monuments les plus prestigieux de Boston. Vous aurez également la chance de voir votre nom ou votre logo sur nos T-shirts que l’on portera lors de la présentation. Enfin, il se peut même que certains d’entre vous viennent avec nous à Boston pour partager cette expérience unique, et que le nom officiel de l'équipe soit tout simplement ... le votre !

Pour aller plus loin

Ce paragraphe s'adresse à ceux qui s’intéressent à la partie scientifique du projet.

Concrètement nous avons étudié les séquences génétiques des protéines naturelles élastiques et nous nous en sommes inspirés pour réaliser des gènes synthétiques. Ainsi la bactérie produira des protéines élastiques. Grâce à la construction génique utilisée (Biobrick assembly) et optimisée, cela permet de systématiser les constructions géniques et de fusionner les gènes, on peut donc ainsi créer de nouvelles protéines élastiques. 

Dans le détail, une fois l'ADN intégré dans les bactéries on lance la production de protéines en mettant en culture les bactéries dans un milieu de culture en Erlenmeyer de 2 L.

Ensuite les bactéries sont incubées à 37°C pendant 21h.

Puis on va tuer les bactéries et récupérer les protéines par centrifugation. 
Au final on récupère des fractions pures de protéines et ainsi on peut tester les caractéristiques physiques et structurales.

Résultats

La fraction pure de protéine nous a permis d'identifier une première caractéristique intéressante, visible dans la vidéo ci-dessous.

De plus avec les protéines solubles nous avons fabriqué des fils élastiques par wet spinning (précipitation dans de l'eau salée) : voir photo et vidéo ci-dessous 

 


L'impact

Si vous voulez en savoir plus sur notre équipe et sur la manière dont nous pouvons modifier des bactéries pour leur faire produire des matériaux intéressants, je vous invite chaleureusement à nous écrire un mail à igembordeaux@gmail.com. Au-delà d’une simple participation financière à un événement scientifique, votre contribution va permettre à de jeunes étudiants, futur chercheurs ou ingénieurs, de réaliser leur premier projet scientifique et de se confronter à la réalité du monde de la recherche. En marquant ainsi votre intérêt pour la biologie et en nous faisant confiance, votre engagement devient synonyme d’encouragements et de motivation.

L'iGEM est une compétition reconnue dans le monde entier. La presse et les sites internet spécialisés relatent évidemment cet évènement et parlent de nous :

http://labiotech.fr/les-equipes-francaise-lassaut-digem-2014-competition-mondiale-biologie-synthetique/

L’équipe de Bordeaux a déjà participé à deux reprises au concours iGEM et a remporté une médaille de bronze lors de l’édition 2012. Pour cette troisième participation, l’équipe de Bordeaux se présente avec un projet original et une équipe plus que motivée rendant ainsi nos chances de médailles bien réelles. Mais vous l’avez compris, cette aventure ne peut se concrétiser qu’avec votre aide.



D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous êtes vous-même étudiant ou que vous n’avez pas les moyens de contribuer financièrement à notre projet il vous reste encore plein d’autres solutions pour nous montrer votre soutien. Un simple message d’encouragement à igembordeaux@gmail.com saura redonner de l’énergie à toute l’équipe pendant les longues soirées passées au laboratoire. Vous pouvez aussi tout simplement en parler autour de vous, faire découvrir le projet à vos amis et à vos proches ou nous suivre sur les réseaux sociaux.

Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/BordeauxIGEM?fref=ts

Twitter : https://twitter.com/BordeauxIGEM @BordeauxIGEM



Merci à tous pour cette attention et pour votre participation.



L'équipe iGEM Bordeaux 2014
story_txt:
1.Description générale du projet.2.Précision sur le projet3.Résultats


Le projet Elasticoli 



Bonjour à tous et bienvenue sur la page du projet
Elasticoli. Derrière ce nom un peu étrange se cache en réalité un projet
scientifique ambitieux mené par un groupe d’étudiants bordelais. 

Bien sûr, ne vous en faites pas, nous allons tout faire pour rendre ce projet le plus compréhensible possible auprès de tous ! Ce projet est tout ce qu’il y a de plus sérieux et s’inscrit dans le cadre d’une compétition étudiante
internationale : l’iGEM (international Genetically Engineered Machines).

Cette compétition, comme son nom l’indique est une compétition de biologie de synthèse (on reviendra sur ce principe plus tard) organisée par le prestigieux MIT (Massachussetts Institute of Technology, Boston) qui rassemble cette année plusieurs centaines d’équipes à travers le monde. 
Comme chaque équipe participante, nous allons utiliser
les outils de la biologie de synthèse pour imaginer et créer de nouveaux
systèmes biologiques avec des propriétés étonnantes. La biologie de synthèse,
c’est un des domaines qui connait le plus de croissance dans le secteur de la
biologie et des biotechnologies. Cette discipline regroupe l’ensemble des
techniques utilisées par les généticiens, les biologistes moléculaires et
autres scientifiques qui permettent de concevoir des organismes vivants avec
des caractéristiques inédites. 
Oui bon euh ... ça serait drôle en effet, mais ce n'est
rien de tout ça. Ce que nous allons utiliser pour créer notre système
biologique est un être vivant bien plus petit , même invisible à l’œil nu et
pourtant présent dans chacun de nous. 
C’est
Escherichia coli, une bactérie bien connue des scientifiques. 
Bien évidemment ! Vous ne le savez surement pas mais
les bactéries sont utiles pour plein de choses. Ce sont même elles aujourd’hui
qui produisent une partie des biocarburants ou certains de nos médicaments.
Ce que nous allons leur faire fabriquer, ce sont des matériaux avec des propriétés
plastiques, élastiques et entièrement biodégradables. 



 Oui en quelque sorte, mais avec des applications plus
ciblées vers la santé et la médecine. Plus concrètement, nous allons faire produire
à nos bactéries, un ensemble de protéines 
comme celles que l’on retrouve dans les toiles d’araignées ou celles
responsables de l’élasticité de notre peau qui vont ensuite s’assembler et
former ce qu’on appelle des polymères. 

C’est tout à
fait ça, après quelques étapes d’électrospining ou autres procédés aux noms
barbares on devrait obtenir des fils avec une élasticité et une résistance
incroyable. Ces fils pourraient par exemple, dans le futur, être utilisés par
les chirurgiens pour remplacer des tendons endommagés !



L'équipe iGEM Bordeaux 

Ce projet c’est
avant tout une expérience qui se vit en groupe. L’équipe IGEM Bordeaux 2014
c’est Diane, Claudia, Gilles, Edouard, Jean-Rémy, Mounir, Justine,
Xavier, Julien, Zohra, Caroline, Floriane, Cassandra, Alexandre,
Geoffrey, Hiba, Lauriane et Ismaël, tous étudiants en école d’ingénieur (ENSTBB) ou à
l’Université de Bordeaux et encadrés par Denis Dupuy, Marie Beurton-Aimar et
Elisabeth Garanger, chercheurs rattachés à l’INSERM ou au CNRS. Mais l’équipe
IGEM Bordeaux 2014 c’est aussi toutes les personnes qui nous entourent au
quotidien et qui nous aident à avancer dans ce projet ambitieux. Et puis, cette
équipe c’est aussi un peu vous, passionnés de sciences ou simples curieux, qui comprenez l’intérêt de notre projet et
l’intérêt de la biologie dans notre société actuelle. Au nom de toute l’équipe
je vous adresse d’ores et déjà nos sincères remerciements pour les quelques
minutes passées à découvrir notre projet.


Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Vous vous en doutez, la recherche de
financements est une étape cruciale dans la réussite de notre projet. Nous
sommes déjà soutenus par notre université et par quelques entreprises telles que Teknimed (spécialisée dans les biomatériaux), l'Ambassade de France aux Etats-Unis, la Région Aquitaine, Genscript, l'INSERM et le CNRS, mais nous
avions envie, pour compléter notre budget, d’un financement collaboratif. Avec
le "crowdfunding", nous souhaitons faire découvrir notre projet à un
maximum de personnes. Cette plateforme nous permet, en plus de récolter des
fonds, d’interagir directement avec vous, d’échanger nos idées et de vous faire
part de nos avancées. Vous vous impliquez dans notre projet et on s’engage à
une totale transparence, c’est là le principe séduisant du financement participatif. 

L’argent que nous arriverons à récolter servira en premier
à financer l’achat de matériel pour le laboratoire. 

Malheureusement non, entre les
molécules chimiques qui rentrent dans la composition des milieux de culture ou
les consommables utilisés pour les manipulations, les frais de laboratoire
peuvent vite devenir importants. Mais nous avons déjà réussi à produire un peu de nos fameuses protéines ! Ensuite, une autre partie du financement
servira à couvrir les frais d’inscription de l’équipe (2 600 €) et des
participants (550 € par membre de l’équipe). C’est ce que représentent donc
les 15 000 € dont nous avons besoin. Enfin, si vous vous montrez très
généreux, l’argent restant sera utilisé pour envoyer un maximum de personnes de
l’équipe présenter le projet. Et oui, souvenez-vous, la compétition est
organisée par le MIT, et je vous laisse deviner où est localisé ce prestigieux
institut ? 


On est d’accord. C’est là-bas que toutes les équipes
du monde participant au concours se retrouveront en octobre 2014 et qu’un jury
spécialisé décernera les récompenses. Pour en savoir plus
sur la compétition et sur cette année particulière qui marque le 10ème
anniversaire de l’IGEM je vous invite à consulter le site internet
officiel : http://2014.igem.org/Main_Page

En plus de nos sincères
remerciements et de la satisfaction d’avoir accompli un acte généreux,
l’équipe IGEM Bordeaux 2014 à envisagé différentes contreparties pour vous
faire plaisir. Ainsi, vous vous verrez offrir, entre autres, des stickers, des
cartes postales de Boston avec un mot de l’équipe, des t-shirts de l’équipe, des mugs ou encore des casquettes à nos couleurs, mais aussi des contreparties bien plus originales comme notre jeu de société IGAME inventé et développé par l’équipe qui vous assurera des moments sympas entre amis ou en famille tout en découvrant la biologie et la compétition iGEM.

portant une banderole à votre nom devant les monuments les plus prestigieux de

expérience unique, et que le nom officiel de l'équipe soit tout simplement ... le votre !

story:
Video: Blue Waves Rider Burnzio Innes

I am raising funds to buy one motorcycle and safety gear to outfit a ranger.  On my own dime I am going to go to Mongolia to deliver it to the ranger in person. Entire airfare comes out of my own pocket, and I am volunteering my time both here with fundraising and coordination, and in Mongolia with coordination and delivery.

Lake Hovsgol is one of the last best places!

The Lake and surrounding wildlife area is a National Park bigger than Yellowstone and strictly protected as a transition zone between Central Asian Steppe and the Siberian Taiga.  It's one of 17 ancient lakes that are more than 2 million years old, and the water is so clean you can drink it without any treatment.  There are a number of indigenous people that live around it and depend on it for their water supply.  In fact  it contains 70% of all the surface freshwater supply for the whole country of Mongolia.  There is no body of water this clean and this large in America. None.  Imagine what Lake Tahoe was like 400 years ago...thats what Lake Hovsgol is now and its 4 times as big.

So what's threatening it?

Illegal poaching, including illegal drift net fishing, illegal logging: The lake has fish, including two endemic species, and since it's a lake, those fish can easily become overfished as every other fish population in the world has become.  The surrounding parklands are home to a number of really awesome animals, including ibex, argali, elk, wolf, wolverine, musk deer, brown bear, Siberian moose, and sable.

Mongolia has done a good job designating this area as a wildlife preserve to protect the survival of these animals, but enforcement is challenging.  Rangers have been stabbed and injured trying to enforce the law against poachers, who stand to make a great deal of money in the short term.

Illegal development and tourism: It shouldn't be news to Americans that people in and from outside Mongolia are eager to develop properties around the lake.  Rangers have caught individuals simply building around it without permits. Run off and pollution from illegal development and road building is certain to pollute the lake, as well as impact wildlife habitat.  Additionally outsiders have come in and started developing environmental tourism projects without necessarily caring for the habitat or obtaining permission.

But they have rangers to enforce the laws, right?

Yes, the whole park is about 4,600 square miles (1.2mm hectares) and there are 15 permanent rangers and a few seasonal ones.  Each ranger patrols over 300 square miles of park, which is about the same size as all the boroughs in New York City.  And they do it mostly on horseback.  For reference, Yellowstone is smaller and has 300 permanent Park Rangers.  Imagine if there was only one policeman in a space as big as the five boroughs of New York City, and he was on horseback chasing bad guys in jeeps.

The poachers and illegal users in the park tool around in jeeps, 4x4's, and other vehicles.  Did I also mention the poachers are armed?

The rangers have asked for help in the form of offroad motorcycles, gear, and training.  With modern offroad motorcycles, they could patrol more effectively and discourage lawbreakers.

So why do I care, and how can I help?

It's true, Mongolia is halfway around the world, but I care, and here's why:

  • We don't have that many wild places left in the world.  
  • We don't have that much wildlife left in the world.
  • I love nature, I spend a lot of time in nature, and it's not often that I get to actually do hands-on volunteering to not only help protect one of the last pristine natural places in the world, but at the same time help improve the work life of an individual who is protecting this area. That's just awesome!

Even if you aren't moved by this situation, I ask that you support me in my effort to keep this wild area as pristine as possible. You can help by donating to help cover the cost of a motorcycle and equipment.

Where does the money go?

100% of the money you donate is tax-deductible, and goes to buy and ship the motorcycle and equipment. I am paying my own ticket over, and the Mongol Ecology Center is not taking any of it for administration, it all goes directly to equipment for the rangers! 

I am trying to fund one motorcycle and equipment.  Each motorcycle and equipment, along with shipping, costs $7,400.   I am trying to raise enough to outfit one ranger.  Any additional money goes to buying a second motorcycle if I exceed my fundraising goal.

story:
Folks from across so-called Colorado are invited to the East Tavaputs Plateau in so-called Utah from July 11-17. Come for a week of workshops, discussions, and hiking alongside land defenders protecting the plateau from the first commercial tar sands mine in the US. The week will include discussions on climate justice, decolonization, anti-oppression, nonviolent direct action training, and role plays, as well as hiking and capture the flag in the woods.

In an effort to build solidarity across the region, we plan to bring different elements of Colorado's student-led environmental, divestment, and other movements together, along with non-student led efforts. By building relationships, we can see that our many different struggles are all connected and fight our common enemies in defense of Mother Earth.

With myriad companies waiting in the wings to see if US Oil Sands' tar sands mine gets off the ground, a huge area of the Colorado Plateau is at stake. Come help us defend this region from the threat of tar sands and oil shale.  We need all the support we can get, and if you are unable to come, donations help maintain and grow crucial work.  

To learn more about the importance of stopping US Oil Sands check out Peaceful Uprising and Utah Tar Sands Resistance.  http://www.peacefuluprising.org/action/no-tar-s...
